translated: He will come to understand the Dharma more and more, and with right wisdom see things as they are.

original: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba dag chos ston par mi byed mod kyi ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par dbyangs kyis kha ton du byed do //🔽ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji lta bar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par dbyangs kyi kha ton du byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba dag chos ston par mi byed mod kyi ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par dbyangs kyis kha ton du byed do // ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji lta bar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par dbyangs kyi kha ton du byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang /
translated: Moreover, here the noble disciple, even though the teacher or the one who lives the holy life, or someone like them, does not teach the Dharma, recites aloud the teachings that he has heard, as he has learned them, as he has mastered them, in detail.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As he recites aloud the teachings that he has heard, as he has learned them, as he has mastered them, in detail, in that way he comes to know the teachings better and better, and with right wisdom he comes to see things as they are.

original: ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang /
translated: The more he knows and understands phenomena, the more he sees them as they are with correct wisdom, the more he gains the power of the meaning and the power of the Dharma with regard to phenomena.

original: ston pa la rab tu dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa la rab tu dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: He gains faith in the Teacher.

original: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba chos ston par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba chos ston par yang mi byed la /
translated: “Moreover, in this case, a noble disciple does not have a teacher or a spiritual friend who is like a higher realm and who teaches the Dharma.

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du yang mi byed kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du yang mi byed kyi /
translated: He does not recite the teachings in detail that he has heard, that he has understood, and that he has mastered.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par gzhan dag la yang dag par gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par gzhan dag la yang dag par gsal bar byed de /
translated: However, he makes the teachings that he has heard, that he has understood, and that he has mastered clear to others in detail.

original: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par gzhan dag la rab tu gsal bar byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par gzhan dag la rab tu gsal bar byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang /
translated: The more they clarify for others the teachings they have heard, the teachings they have been shown, and the teachings they have understood, the more they will come to know those teachings in a superior way.🔽

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro //🔽ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab @49a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro // ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab @49a * //
translated: “As they teach others the Dharma in detail, just as they have heard it, just as they have taught it, and just as they have understood it, they will come to know the Dharma in a superior way, and with superior knowledge they will see things as they are with correct wisdom.

original: kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang / ston pa la rab tu dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang / ston pa la rab tu dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “As they come to know the Dharma in a superior way, and with superior knowledge see things as they are with correct wisdom, they will come to understand the power of the Dharma and the power of the teacher.

original: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba dag chos ston par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos ston pa 'am tshangs par spyod pa bla ma'i gnas lta bu gang yang rung ba dag chos ston par yang mi byed la /
translated: “Moreover, in this regard, when the noble disciples do not teach the Dharma, or when those who are like the teacher or the one who is like the one who practices pure conduct do not teach the Dharma,

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du yang mi byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams rgyas par kha ton du yang mi byed la /
translated: He does not recite the teachings that he has heard, that he has been taught, and that he has understood.

original: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par gzhan dag la rab tu gsal bar yang mi byed kyi ;🔽'on kyang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams la rgyas par gzhan dag la rab tu gsal bar yang mi byed kyi ; 'on kyang ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: He does not explain in detail to others the teachings that he has heard, that he has been taught, and that he has understood.🔽But he does go alone to a secluded place and reflect,

original: don sems shing 'jal ba dang nye bar rtog par byed do //
analyzed: don sems shing 'jal ba dang nye bar rtog par byed do //
translated: consider, and investigate the meaning of the teachings that he has heard, that he has been taught, and that he has understood.🔽The more he goes alone to a secluded place and reflects,

original: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams gcig pu dben par song ste /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar thos pa dang / ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dang / ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnams gcig pu dben par song ste /
translated: considers, and investigates the meaning of the teachings that he has heard, that he has been taught, and that he has understood,

original: don sems shing 'jal ba dang nye bar rtog par byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don sems shing 'jal ba dang nye bar rtog par byed pa de lta de ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As they contemplate, evaluate, and closely examine the meaning, they will come to know phenomena more and more, and with right wisdom they will see things as they are.

original: ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos rnams la tshul bzhin yid la byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar chos rnams lhag par rig cing lhag par rig pa dang / yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba de lta de ltar chos rnams la don gyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos kyi shugs rnyed pa dang / chos rnams la tshul bzhin yid la byed par 'gyur te /
translated: As they come to know phenomena more and more, and with right wisdom see things as they are, they will come to understand the meaning of phenomena, to understand the Dharma, and to attend to phenomena in the proper manner.

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag pa'i lta ba ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag pa'i lta ba ma skyes pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Right view that has not yet arisen will arise,

original: skyes pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyes pa 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and that which has arisen will increase, expand, and become abundant,🔽through listening to the words of others and through one’s own proper attention.

original: lta ba'i phung po yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed cing rtsol ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / rtsom pa dang / mi gtong ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba'i phung po yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed cing rtsol ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / spro ba dang / rtsom pa dang / mi gtong ba dang /
translated: He generates enthusiasm, makes an effort, is steadfast, exerts his mind, and strives with perfect samādhi and attention in order to perfect the aggregates of the view that are not yet perfect and to maintain the aggregates of the view that are already perfect.

original: sems yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: He holds his mind in check.

original: 'di ni lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the principal purity of the view.

original: stag gi byang chub kyi bu dag rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: stag gi byang chub kyi bu dag rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo gang zhe na /
translated: “Sons of noble family, what is the principal purity of liberation?

original: 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod chags las sems 'dod chags dang rnam par bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin /🔽zhe @49b sdang las sems 'dod chags dang rnam par bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin /
analyzed: 'di na 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod chags las sems 'dod chags dang rnam par bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin / zhe @49b sdang las sems 'dod chags dang rnam par bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin /
translated: Here, the noble disciple’s mind is free from desire and liberated from desire.🔽His mind is free from anger and liberated from anger.

original: gti mug las sems 'dod chags dang rnam bar bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin /
analyzed: gti mug las sems 'dod chags dang rnam bar bral zhing rnam par grol ba yin /
translated: His mind is free from ignorance and liberated from ignorance.

original: 'di ni rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the foremost of the completely pure liberations.

original: de nas ro can pa kron dhi pa dag tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bos bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs te /
analyzed: de nas ro can pa kron dhi pa dag tshe dang ldan ba kun dga' bos bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs te /
translated: Then the people of Rājagṛha rejoiced in and praised what the venerable Ānanda explained.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag byas nas song ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i rkang pa la mgo bos phyag byas nas song ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: They bowed their heads at the feet of the venerable Ānanda and left.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba las gnas drug pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs s+ho /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba las gnas drug pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs s+ho /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya called “The Application of the Sūtras” from the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya.

original: // /'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // /'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the Bhagavān said, “A mind with attachment is a mind with attachment,” and so on.

original: gnas mang po las bshad de /
analyzed: gnas mang po las bshad de /
translated: This is explained in many places.

original: ji ltar re zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la bsgom pa las 'di na dge slong 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la bsgom pa las 'di na dge slong 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: “Here, a bhikṣu, with regard to a mind that is accompanied by attachment, knows as it really is: ‘The mind is accompanied by attachment.’

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: With regard to a mind that is free from attachment, he knows as it really is: ‘The mind is free from attachment.’

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang /
translated: With regard to a mind that is accompanied by hatred, free from hatred, accompanied by delusion, free from delusion, distracted, concentrated,

original: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bsgoms pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang /
translated: not liberated and liberated.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sems la rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sems la rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: With regard to a liberated mind, he knows as it really is: This is a liberated mind.

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems la shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems la shin tu rnam par grol ba'i sems so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: With regard to a very liberated mind, he knows as it really is: This is a very liberated mind.

original: mdo las ji ltar sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las ji ltar sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is the mind internally collected?

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will explain the cultivation of the four bases of supernormal power.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to it well and keep it in mind. I will explain it.”

original: dge slong dag ji @50a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag ji @50a * //
translated: “Monks,

original: ltar na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltar na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa yin zhe na /
translated: how do they cultivate the four bases of supernatural power?🔽Here, a monk thinks, ‘My intention should not be weak,🔽nor should it be seized upon, nor should it be inwardly contracted, nor should it be outwardly scattered.

original: 'di na dge slong bdag gi 'dun pa zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur cig / snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes dang / 'og mas steng 'og gi 'du shes su gyur cig /'dun pa ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la 'dun pa snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong bdag gi 'dun pa zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur cig / snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes dang / 'og mas steng 'og gi 'du shes su gyur cig /'dun pa ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la 'dun pa snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang /
translated: May my prior and subsequent perceptions, and my perceptions of the lower and upper parts of my body, be free of obscurations and coverings, and may my intention be bright and clear.🔽May my intention not be of the nature of darkness.’

original: 'di ltar bdag gi 'dun pa mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dben pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi 'dun pa mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dben pa la gnas pa /
translated: He cultivates the basis of supernatural power that possesses the constituent elements of attention and the constituent elements of exertion, which are free from the hindrances,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /🔽'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spangs pas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /🔽'gog pa la gnas pa rnam par spangs pas yongs su bsgyur ba sgom par byed do //
translated: which are free from the defilements,🔽which are free from the afflictions, and which are free from the secondary afflictions.

original: ji ltar na 'dun pa zhum pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dun pa zhum pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is aspiration slack?

original: le lo dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: le lo dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
translated: When it is associated with laziness.

original: de ltar na 'dun pa zhum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dun pa zhum pa yin no //
translated: In this way, aspiration is slack.

original: ji ltar na 'dun pa rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dun pa rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is aspiration grasped?

original: 'dun pa gang rgod ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa gang rgod ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
translated: When aspiration is associated with agitation.

original: de ltar na 'dun pa rab tu bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dun pa rab tu bzung ba yin no //
translated: In this way, aspiration is grasped.

original: ji ltar na 'dun pa nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dun pa nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is aspiration collected?

original: 'dun pa gang rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa gang rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: When aspiration is associated with lethargy and sleep, is collected inward, is associated with the cessation of discursive thoughts, and is not associated with insight.

original: ji ltar na phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is aspiration distracted outward?

original: 'dun pa gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la g-yengs shing rnam par 'phros pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la g-yengs shing rnam par 'phros pa yin no //
translated: When aspiration is distracted and scattered toward the five sense pleasures.

original: de ltar na 'dun pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dun pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, aspiration is distracted outward.

original: ji ltar na snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one come to have the perception of the past and future?

original: 'di na dge slong so sor rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid legs par rab tu bzung zhing yid la byed pa bsten cing so sor rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong so sor rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid legs par rab tu bzung zhing yid la byed pa bsten cing so sor rig pa ste /
translated: Here, a monk well takes up the characteristics of discernment, relies on mental attention, and is aware.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'dug cing gnas pa la nye bar rtog pa dang / 'dug cing gnyid log pa dang / mdun du 'gro ba dang / phyi nas 'gro ba la nye bar rtog pa de bzhin du dge slong so sor rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid legs par rab tu bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'dug cing gnas pa la nye bar rtog pa dang / 'dug cing gnyid log pa dang / mdun du 'gro ba dang / phyi nas 'gro ba la nye bar rtog pa de bzhin du dge slong so sor rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid legs par rab tu bzung ste /
translated: This is to say,🔽he discerns sitting and dwelling, sitting and sleeping, going in front, and going behind.

original: yid la byed pa bsten cing so sor rig pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bsten cing so sor rig pa ste /
translated: In the same way, a monk well takes up the characteristics of discernment, relies on mental attention, and is aware.

original: 'di ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: This is how one comes to have the perception of the past and future.

original: 'di na dge slong lus 'di la spyi bo nas rkang mthil gyi bar du skra dang / klad pa dang / pags pa'i mthar thug par ji @50b ltar gnas pa dang / ji ltar smon pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa du mas yongs su gang bar so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong lus 'di la spyi bo nas rkang mthil gyi bar du skra dang / klad pa dang / pags pa'i mthar thug par ji @50b ltar gnas pa dang / ji ltar smon pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa du mas yongs su gang bar so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: Here a monk discerns how this body, from the soles of the feet upwards and from the hair and bristles upwards, is full of various kinds of impurities, down to the skin.

original: lus 'di la skra yang yod /🔽ba spu dang / kha dang / so dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa dang / mchin pa dang / gla ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang /🔽pho ba dang / long ka dang / lto ba dang / mcher pa dang / rdul dang / mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khu ba dang / klad pa dang /
analyzed: lus 'di la skra yang yod / ba spu dang / kha dang / so dang / rdul dang / dri ma dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / rus pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa dang / mchin pa dang / gla ba dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / pho ba dang / long ka dang / lto ba dang / mcher pa dang / rdul dang / mchi ma dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / rnag dang / khu ba dang / klad pa dang /
translated: This body has hair of the head,🔽hair of the body, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone-marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, stomach, excrement, tears, grease, spit, mucus, synovial fluid, urine, and brain.

original: klad rgyas dag 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: klad rgyas dag 'dzag pa'o //
translated: It is a place where the brain, the membrane covering the brain, and the fluid in the brain drip.

original: zhes de ltar na steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes de ltar na steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there is the notion of above and below.

original: ji ltar na bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / ji ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / ji ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can my mind be unobscured, uncovered, and bright, and how can my mind not be of the nature of darkness?

original: 'di na dge slong snang ba'i 'du shes legs par rab tu bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong snang ba'i 'du shes legs par rab tu bzung ste /
translated: Here a monk, having well and properly taken up the perception of light,

original: yid la byed de ston cing so sor rig pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed de ston cing so sor rig pa ste /
translated: he teaches and experiences it.

original: nyin mo ji lta bar mtshan mo de bzhin /
analyzed: nyin mo ji lta bar mtshan mo de bzhin /
translated: As it is during the day, so it is at night.

original: mtshan mo ji lta bar nyin mo de bzhin /
analyzed: mtshan mo ji lta bar nyin mo de bzhin /
translated: As it is at night, so it is during the day.

original: sngon ji lta bar phyis de bzhi na /
analyzed: sngon ji lta bar phyis de bzhi na /
translated: As it is before, so it is afterward.

original: phyis ji lta bar sngon de bzhin /
analyzed: phyis ji lta bar sngon de bzhin /
translated: As it is afterward, so it is before.

original: steng du ji lta bar 'og tu de bzhin /
analyzed: steng du ji lta bar 'og tu de bzhin /
translated: As it is above, so it is below.

original: 'og tu ji lta bar steng du de bzhin no zhes bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'og tu ji lta bar steng du de bzhin no zhes bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya ste /
translated: Just as below, so above; just as above, so below.🔽In this way, my mind will be uncovered, unobscured, bright, and clear, and my mind will not be of the nature of darkness.

original: 'di ltar na bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig par gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, my mind will be uncovered, unobscured, bright, and clear, and my mind will not be of the nature of darkness.

original: 'di na dge slong bdag gi dpyod pa zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur cig / snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes dang / steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su gyur cing /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong bdag gi dpyod pa zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs par ma gyur cig / snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'du shes dang / steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su gyur cing /
translated: Here, a monk’s investigation is not slack, not over-aroused, not internally contracted, not externally scattered, not with a prior or subsequent perception, and not with an upper or lower perception.

original: bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig bar gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin @51a * //🔽dang ; dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa /🔽'gog pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: bdag gi sems ma bsgribs shing ma g-yogs la sems snang ba dang bcas shing lhan cig bar gyur pa dang / 'di ltar bdag gi sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin @51a * // dang ; dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dben pa la gnas pa / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa / 'gog pa la gnas pa /
translated: I will not let my mind be obscured, covered, or obscured by darkness.

original: rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba dag sgom par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par spong ba yongs su bsgyur ba dag sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that possesses the component of exertion and the concentration of investigation, based on seclusion, based on nonattraction, based on cessation, and matured by relinquishment.

original: ji ltar dpyod pa zhum pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dpyod pa zhum pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is investigation slack?

original: dpyod pa gang le lo dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang le lo dang lhan cig par gyur pa ste /
translated: Investigation that is accompanied by laziness.

original: de ltar na dpyod pa zhum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dpyod pa zhum pa yin no //
translated: In this way, investigation is slack.

original: ji ltar na dpyod pa rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dpyod pa rab tu bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is investigation grasped?

original: dpyod pa gang rgod pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa gang rgod pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa'o //
translated: Investigation that is accompanied by agitation.

original: ji ltar na dpyod pa nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dpyod pa nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there internal withdrawal of investigation?

original: dpyod pa gang rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur cing nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur la lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa yin te /
translated: Investigation is accompanied by lethargy and sleepiness, is accompanied by internal fixation, and is not associated with insight.

original: 'di ltar na dpyod pa nang du bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar na dpyod pa nang du bsdus pa yin no //
translated: In this way there is internal withdrawal of investigation.

original: ji ltar dpyod pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dpyod pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there external distraction of investigation?

original: dpyod pa gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su g-yengs shing rnam par 'phros pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la rjes su g-yengs shing rnam par 'phros pa yin te /
translated: Investigation is distracted and scattered with regard to the five sense pleasures.

original: 'di ltar na dpyod pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar na dpyod pa phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa yin no //
translated: In this way there is external distraction of investigation.

original: ji ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'du shes zhes bya ba nas /
translated: How is there the perception of the past and the perception of the future?

original: snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar bdag sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar bdag sems mun pa'i rang bzhin du ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: As before, up to: “May my mind not become dark.”

original: dge slong dag de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, you should cultivate the four bases of supernormal power in this way.

original: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad bshad pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so //🔽zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rgyas par bshad pa de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom pa dag bstan par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad bshad pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes gsungs so // zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / nang du bsdus pa dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rgyas par bshad pa de bzhin du brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Monks, I have explained in detail what I said in brief when I said, “I will teach the cultivation of the four bases of supernormal power.”🔽Just as it is explained in detail in the sutra that the concentration of aspiration is slack, tight, inwardly withdrawn, outwardly scattered, and so on, so too you should understand in detail all the concentrations of effort,

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la yang thams cad rgyas par go bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin la yang thams cad rgyas par go bar bya ste /
translated: mindfulness, and equanimity.

original: de ltar na shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, you will understand.

original: mdo las ji ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las ji ltar na sems nang du bsdus pa yin zhe na /
translated: The sutra asks: How is the mind inwardly withdrawn?

original: gang gi tshe sems zhum par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems zhum par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It replies: When the mind is slack.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po dag snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
translated: Then, in the morning, many monks put on their robes and took up their bowls,

original: bsod snyoms kyi phyir mnyan yod du zhugs so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi phyir mnyan yod du zhugs so //
translated: and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir re @51b zhig nam ma nangs kyi /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir re @51b zhig nam ma nangs kyi /
translated: Then the many monks thought, “It is still too early to go for alms in Śrāvastī.

original: bdag cag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag gi kun dga' ra bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag cag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag gi kun dga' ra bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Let us go to the pleasure grove of those tīrthika practitioners.”

original: de nas gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag gis dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag gis dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then those tīrthika practitioners said to the many monks,🔽“Your śramaṇa Gautama teaches his disciples thus: ‘Monks, give up the five hindrances,

original: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma nyan thos rnams la 'di ltar dge slong dag tshur shog / sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
analyzed: khyed cag gi dge sbyong goo ta ma nyan thos rnams la 'di ltar dge slong dag tshur shog / sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
translated: which are the defilements of mind,

original: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa /
analyzed: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa /
translated: weakening wisdom,

original: gnod pa'i phyogs mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa dag spongs la /
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa dag spongs la /
translated: and do not enter into the sphere of nirvāṇa.’

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi pa rnams la sems legs par gzhag cing gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi pa rnams la sems legs par gzhag cing gnas te /
translated: They should properly focus and settle their minds on the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽They should cultivate the seven factors of awakening.🔽When they hear this Dharma teaching, they will think, ‘Come here!

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom par gyis shig ces nyan thos rnams la chos ston pa thos nas bdag cag 'di ltar khyed cag tshur shog / sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgom par gyis shig ces nyan thos rnams la chos ston pa thos nas bdag cag 'di ltar khyed cag tshur shog / sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
translated: Abandon the five obscurations that afflict the mind,

original: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa /
analyzed: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa /
translated: weaken wisdom,

original: gnod pa'i phyogs mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa dag spongs la ;
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs mya ngan las 'das par mi 'jug pa dag spongs la ;
translated: and prevent you from entering the sphere of peace, nirvāṇa.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po rnams la sems legs par gzhag cing gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po rnams la sems legs par gzhag cing gnas te /
translated: Properly focus and settle your minds on the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgoms shig ces nyan thos rnams la chos ston na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgoms shig ces nyan thos rnams la chos ston na /
translated: Cultivate the seven factors of awakening.’

original: 'di ltar na dge sbyong goo ta mas chos bstan pa dang bdag cag gis chos bstan pa la khyad par dang / bsam pa dang / tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar na dge sbyong goo ta mas chos bstan pa dang bdag cag gis chos bstan pa la khyad par dang / bsam pa dang / tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: In this way, what is the difference between the Dharma teaching of the ascetic Gautama and our Dharma teaching? What is the difference in our intentions and what we do?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / dge slong rab tu mang po de dag cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / dge slong rab tu mang po de dag cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: The many monks remained silent.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyud de dag gis bshad pa la mngon par dga' bar yang mi byed khro bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo //🔽de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag mnyan yod du bsod snyoms spyad cing zas kyi bya ba byas nas zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed bkrus te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyud de dag gis bshad pa la mngon par dga' bar yang mi byed khro bar yang mi byed par stan las langs te song ngo // de nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag mnyan yod du bsod snyoms spyad cing zas kyi bya ba byas nas zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed bkrus te /
translated: Then the many monks, without delighting in or being angry at the explanations of those non-Buddhist wanderers, rose from their seats and left.

original: chos gos dang lhung bzed mtha' cig tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: chos gos dang lhung bzed mtha' cig tu bzhag ste /
translated: Then the many monks, having gone for alms in Śrāvastī, having finished their meal and having finished their business after the meal,🔽having washed their feet,

original: rkang pa bkrus nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: rkang pa bkrus nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: approached the Blessed One.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag gis gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag dang lhan cig ji srid du gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol @52a * //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag gis gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag dang lhan cig ji srid du gtam gzhan brjod pa de thams cad rgyas par bcom ldan 'das la gsol @52a * //
translated: Having sat down to one side, the many monks related to the Blessed One all that had been said in the conversation with the tīrthika parivrājakas.

original: to ; / de skad ces gsol ba dang / dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: to ; / de skad ces gsol ba dang / dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When they had finished, the Blessed One said to the many monks,

original: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de skad smra ba de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de skad smra ba de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, you should say to those tīrthika parivrājakas who speak in this way:

original: gang gi tshe sems bying ba dang / bying bar dogs pa de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems bying ba dang / bying bar dogs pa de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus yin /
translated: ‘When the mind is sinking or you fear it may sink, when is it time to cultivate which of the factors of awakening?

original: gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus ma yin /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus ma yin /
translated: When is it not time to cultivate which of the factors of awakening?

original: gang gi tshe rgod pa dang / rgod par dogs pa de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgod pa dang / rgod par dogs pa de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus yin /
translated: When the mind is agitated or you fear it may become agitated, when is it time to cultivate which of the factors of awakening?

original: gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus ma yin zhes dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag la 'di skad du dris pa na /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgom pa'i dus ma yin zhes dge slong dag gzhan mu stegs can gyi kun du rgyu de dag la 'di skad du dris pa na /
translated: “Monks, if you ask, ‘When is it not the time to cultivate samādhi?’

original: phan tshun 'dri bar 'gyur /
analyzed: phan tshun 'dri bar 'gyur /
translated: they will ask each other questions.

original: gtam gzhan nye bar 'god par 'gyur /
analyzed: gtam gzhan nye bar 'god par 'gyur /
translated: They will bring up other topics.

original: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / 'tshig pa dang / gnod pa dang / mi bzod pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang / 'tshig pa dang / gnod pa dang / mi bzod pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will be angry, hostile, proud, spiteful, harmful, and intolerant.

original: kha rog par gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: kha rog par gnas par 'gyur /
translated: They will remain silent.

original: yi mug par 'gyur /
analyzed: yi mug par 'gyur /
translated: They will be depressed.

translated: The mind that is not associated with that, the mind that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and so on.🔽The sūtras state:

original: dge slong nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: dge slong nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /

translated: and subject to change.

original: 'di ni gzugs kyi nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kyi nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the danger in form.

original: gang yang gzugs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: Also, the subduing of desire and passion and the abandonment of desire and passion in regard to form, the complete transcendence of desire and passion in regard to form,

original: 'di ni gzugs kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs kyi nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the escape in regard to form.

original: gang yang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa la brten te /
analyzed: gang yang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa la brten te /
translated: Also, the arising of pleasure and happiness dependent on feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i ro myang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i ro myang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of pleasure and mental pleasure is called the relishing of consciousness.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can te /
translated: Consciousness is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the danger in consciousness.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul zhing 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: The subduing of desire and passion, the abandonment of desire and passion, the full abandonment of desire and passion for consciousness,

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the escape from consciousness.

original: btsun pa legs so zhes dge slong de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa legs so zhes dge slong de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Very good, Lord,” that monk said to the Lord, and he asked the Lord further:

original: btsun pa ci tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa ci tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, what is a self?”

original: dge slong byis pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa gzugs la bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs yod gzugs la bdag yod de zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong byis pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa gzugs la bdag go zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs yod gzugs la bdag yod de zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: “Monks, a foolish, ordinary person, untrained in learning, sees form as self, and sees self as possessing form, and sees form in self, and sees self in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin no //🔽bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin no // bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
translated: They see feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as self,🔽see self as possessing consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag yod do zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag yod do zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ste /
translated: see consciousness in self, and see self in consciousness.

original: dge slong 'di tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong 'di tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, this is how much there is to the so-called self.

original: btsun pa legs so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa legs so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Excellent, Bhadanta!” said those monks, and they listened to the Venerable Master.

original: btsun pa ji tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa ji tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Bhadanta, how much is there not to the so-called self?”

original: dge slong 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa gzugs bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs yod gzugs la bdag yod do zhes @56a * //
analyzed: dge slong 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa gzugs bdag yin no zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / bdag la gzugs yod gzugs la bdag yod do zhes @56a * //
translated: The noble monk who is a śrāvaka and is learned does not see form as the self, nor does he see the self as possessing form, nor does he see form in the self, nor does he see the self in form.🔽

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: “Bhikṣus, a noble ārya śrāvaka who has learning does not see form as the self, does not see the self as possessing form, does not see form in the self, and does not see the self in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin no //🔽bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag yin no // bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang / bdag la rnam par shes pa yod /
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as the self,

original: rnam par shes pa la bdag yod do zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bdag yod do zhes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: does not see the self as possessing consciousness, does not see consciousness in the self, and does not see the self in consciousness.

original: dge slong 'di tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong 'di tsam gyis na bdag ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhikṣus, this is the extent to which one does not become ‘me’ or ‘mine.’

original: btsun pa legs so zhes snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa legs so zhes snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ” “Excellent, O Blessed One!”

original: btsun pa ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong na de ma thag tu zag pa zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong na de ma thag tu zag pa zad par 'gyur /
translated: “O Blessed One, how does one know and see so that the outflows do not arise?”

original: dge slong 'di na gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: dge slong 'di na gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa 'am /
translated: “Bhikṣus, whatever form there is—whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, good or bad, far or near—

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: past,

original: da ltar byung ba 'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba 'am /
translated: present,

original: nang gi 'am /
analyzed: nang gi 'am /
translated: internal,

original: phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am /
translated: external, gross,

original: phra ba 'am /
analyzed: phra ba 'am /
translated: subtle,

original: dman pa 'am /
analyzed: dman pa 'am /
translated: inferior,

original: gya nom pa 'am /
analyzed: gya nom pa 'am /
translated: superior,

original: gang thag ring ba 'am /🔽thag nye ba de thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: gang thag ring ba 'am / thag nye ba de thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
translated: distant,

original: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la de dag kyang bdag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la de dag kyang bdag gi ma yin no //
translated: or near, all of them are not mine, I am not theirs, and they are not mine.🔽In this way, with correct wisdom, he sees and fully understands things as they are.

original: zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing rab tu shes pa dang / dge slong 'di na tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba dang / 'du shes dang ; 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba 'das pa 'am /🔽ma 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing rab tu shes pa dang / dge slong 'di na tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba dang / 'du shes dang ; 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba 'das pa 'am / ma 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: “Monks, whatever there is of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, whether past,

original: da ltar byung ba 'am /🔽nang gi 'am /🔽phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am /🔽phra ba 'am /🔽dman pa 'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba 'am / nang gi 'am / phyi'i 'am / rags pa 'am / phra ba 'am / dman pa 'am /
translated: present, or future,

original: gya nom pa'am /🔽gang thag nye ba 'am thag ring ba de dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: gya nom pa'am / gang thag nye ba 'am thag ring ba de dag thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
translated: internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or excellent,

original: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la /
translated: distant or near, all of it is not mine, I am not that, and it is not my self.

original: de dag kyang bdag gi ma yin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gi ma yin no zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: These are not my mother.’

original: dge slong 'di ltar shes shing 'di ltar mthong na de ma thag tu zag pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ltar shes shing 'di ltar mthong na de ma thag tu zag pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bhikṣus, if one knows and sees in this way, one’s defilements will be extinguished.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan mi mkhas pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su nub pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan mi mkhas pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs su nub pa /
translated: “Then there was another bhikṣu in the assembly who was ignorant and had not yet broken out of the shell of ignorance.

original: mig nyams pa ston pa'i bstan pa spangs pa zhig 'khor de na 'dus par gyur cing tshogs te 'dug pa de la 'di lta bu'i sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa skyes te /
analyzed: mig nyams pa ston pa'i bstan pa spangs pa zhig 'khor de na 'dus par gyur cing tshogs te 'dug pa de la 'di lta bu'i sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa skyes te /
translated: He had lost his eye of discernment and had abandoned the teaching of the Teacher. He had the following evil thought:

original: gzugs bdag ma yin /🔽tshor ba bdag ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs bdag ma yin / tshor ba bdag ma yin /
translated: ‘Form is not the self.🔽Feeling is not the self.

original: 'du shes bdag ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes bdag ma yin /
translated: Perception is not the self.

original: 'du byed bdag ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed bdag ma yin /

original: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin na /

analyzed: bdag med pas byas pa bdag gis ji ltar myong bar 'gyur /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the mind of that monk, addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag gal te skyes bu rmongs pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sdubs  su nub cing mig nyams pa ston pa'i bstan pa spangs pas 'khor 'dir 'dus shing tshogs te 'dug pa 'ga' zhig la gzugs @56b bdag ma yin /🔽tshor ba bdag ma yin /🔽'du shes bdag ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te skyes bu rmongs pa ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sdubs  su nub cing mig nyams pa ston pa'i bstan pa spangs pas 'khor 'dir 'dus shing tshogs te 'dug pa 'ga' zhig la gzugs @56b bdag ma yin / tshor ba bdag ma yin / 'du shes bdag ma yin /
translated: “Monks, if some deluded person, sunk in the shell of ignorance, with impaired vision, having abandoned the Teacher’s teaching, were to ask in this assembly, ‘If form is not the self,🔽if feeling is not the self,

original: 'du byed bdag ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed bdag ma yin /
translated: if perception is not the self,🔽if mental formations are not the self,

original: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin na /
translated: if consciousness is not the self,

original: bdag med pas byas pa'i las bdag gis ji ltar myong bar 'gyur zhes sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu skyes nas yongs su 'dri ba'i gnas yod kyis /
analyzed: bdag med pas byas pa'i las bdag gis ji ltar myong bar 'gyur zhes sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu skyes nas yongs su 'dri ba'i gnas yod kyis /
translated: how can I, who am selfless, experience the karma I have created?’ and were to ask about this kind of sinful view,

original: dge slong dag ngas khyed cag 'dul bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas khyed cag 'dul bar bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I will instruct you.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this:

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think?

original: gzugs rtag pa zhig gam mi rtag pa zhig / btsun pa mi rtag pa'o //🔽gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs rtag pa zhig gam mi rtag pa zhig / btsun pa mi rtag pa'o // gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Venerable One, it is impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba ma yin ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ma yin ;
translated: What is impermanent is it suffering or not suffering?

original: btsun pa sdug bsngal ba'o //🔽gang mi rtag cing sdug bsngal ba de yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa bdag ces bya ba dang / 'di dag bdag gi /🔽bdag kyang 'di dag gi /
analyzed: btsun pa sdug bsngal ba'o // gang mi rtag cing sdug bsngal ba de yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa bdag ces bya ba dang / 'di dag bdag gi / bdag kyang 'di dag gi /
translated: Venerable One, it is suffering.

original: de dag kyang bdag gi bdag yin no zhes nye bar 'gro 'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gi bdag yin no zhes nye bar 'gro 'am /
translated: What is impermanent, suffering, and subject to change, can the noble disciple who possesses right view consider it as: ‘This is mine, this I am, this is my self’?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: Venerable One, he cannot.

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness permanent or impermanent?

original: mi rtag pa zhig / btsun pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du nye bar 'gro 'am zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhig / btsun pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du nye bar 'gro 'am zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Venerable One, it is impermanent. … Can the noble disciple who possesses right view consider it as: ‘This is mine, this I am, this is my self’?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: Venerable One, he cannot.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na gzugs gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa 'am /
translated: “Therefore, monks, whatever form there is—whether past,

original: ma 'ongs pa 'am /🔽da ltar byung ba 'am /🔽nang gi 'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'am / da ltar byung ba 'am / nang gi 'am /
translated: future, or present,

original: phyi'i 'am / rags pa'am /
analyzed: phyi'i 'am / rags pa'am /
translated: internal or external,

original: phra ba'am / dman pa'am /🔽gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: phra ba'am / dman pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: gross or subtle,

original: thag ring ba'am /🔽thag nye ba de thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: thag ring ba'am / thag nye ba de thams cad bdag gi ma yin la /
translated: inferior or excellent,

original: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang de dag gi ma yin la /
translated: far or near—all that is not mine, I am not that, that is not my self.

original: de dag kyang bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gi bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should see things as they are with right wisdom, as explained above.🔽Whatever there is of feeling,

analyzed: tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba 'das pa'am /

original: ma 'ongs pa'am /🔽da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am / da ltar byung ba'am /

original: nang gi 'am /
analyzed: nang gi 'am /

original: phyi'i 'am zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyi'i 'am zhes bya ba nas /
translated: inferior or excellent,🔽far or near—all that is not mine, I am not that, that is not my self.🔽Thus, one should see things as they are with right wisdom, as explained above.

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: As before, one should see things as they are with right wisdom.

analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar mthong ba'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa gzugs las grol zhing /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @57a * //

analyzed: sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'o zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say that he is liberated from suffering.

analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na dge slong rab tu mang po dag nye bar len pa med pa zag pa dag las sems rnam par grol bar gyur to zhes gsungs so //

original: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //

analyzed: ces bya ba'i skabs su ji ltar sred pa rnam par spyod pa zhes bya bar bris zin to //

analyzed: dge slong dag 'du byed ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la /

original: dge slong dag 'du byed ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'du byed ni sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Monks, conditioned states are suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is peace.

original: rgyu las kun du byung ba rnams ni sdug bsngal ba ste /

analyzed: de dag mtho @60b ris sna tshogs dag / bgrod nas bdud rtsi go 'phang thob //
translated: Having traversed the various higher existences, they attain the state of immortality.

original: 'di ltar ji bzhin thos nas ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji bzhin thos nas ni //
translated: Having heard it just as it is,

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das 'og tu //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das 'og tu //
translated: after my nirvāṇa,

original: srid pa'i rgya mtshor 'khyam 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgya mtshor 'khyam 'gyur zhes //
translated: wander in the ocean of existence,

original: dge ba mang po rab tu bya //
analyzed: dge ba mang po rab tu bya //
translated: and perform much virtue.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for without afflictions and so on,

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod kyi lho phyogs na bzhugs pa na bram ze sbas pa la shin tu khro ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bu zhig skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod kyi lho phyogs na bzhugs pa na bram ze sbas pa la shin tu khro ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bu zhig skyes par gyur to //
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling to the south of Śrāvastī. A son was born to the brahman Upatiṣya, who had a very wrathful nature.

original: ji tsam na pha'i srid srung gi rig byed kyi las kyi mtha' dag bor te rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na pha'i srid srung gi rig byed kyi las kyi mtha' dag bor te rab tu byung ngo //
translated: When he grew up, he abandoned all the rites of his father's Vedic ritual and went forth.

original: de de na yang khro ba'i rang bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: de de na yang khro ba'i rang bzhin du gyur te /
translated: Even then, he had a wrathful nature.

original: bya dang ri dags dag la gnod pa byed pa na /
analyzed: bya dang ri dags dag la gnod pa byed pa na /
translated: He harmed birds and deer.

original: nags tshal la gnas pa'i lha rnams kyis de de na gnas su mi ster te /
analyzed: nags tshal la gnas pa'i lha rnams kyis de de na gnas su mi ster te /
translated: The gods dwelling in the forest did not allow him to stay there.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten mngon par dang bar byed pa'i cho 'phrul chen po ston pa de'i tshe cho 'phrul chen po de la nags tshal la gnas pa'i lha de dag mngon par dang ste /🔽snying rjes smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten mngon par dang bar byed pa'i cho 'phrul chen po ston pa de'i tshe cho 'phrul chen po de la nags tshal la gnas pa'i lha de dag mngon par dang ste / snying rjes smras pa /
translated: When the Blessed One was displaying the great miracle that delights gods and men, the gods who lived in the forest were filled with faith in that great miracle.🔽With compassion, they said, The Buddha, who is an ornament of the world, has appeared.

original: 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas byung gi / khyod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir song shig ces ji srid du rgyal byed kyi tshal du khrid pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas byung gi / khyod bcom ldan 'das blta ba'i phyir song shig ces ji srid du rgyal byed kyi tshal du khrid pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Go to see the Blessed One! And so on, up to when he was brought to Jetavana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dad par byed pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bkye ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dad par byed pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bkye ste /
translated: The Blessed One emitted a circle of light that inspired faith in him.

original: ji tsam na rab tu byung ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na rab tu byung ba'i bar du ste /
translated: And so on, up to when he went forth.

original: byams pa goms par byas nas dgra /
analyzed: byams pa goms par byas nas dgra /
translated: Having cultivated loving-kindness,

original: bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
translated: he attained the state of an arhat.

original: rab 'byor zhes ming grags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes ming grags par gyur pa'o //
translated: He became known by the name Subhūti.

original: grang dang / yul dang / ljongs gang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba na bdag la su yang sems nyon mongs par ma gyur cig ces bya ba rnam par bltas te /
analyzed: grang dang / yul dang / ljongs gang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba na bdag la su yang sems nyon mongs par ma gyur cig ces bya ba rnam par bltas te /
translated: When he goes to any village, town, or country for alms, he looks around, thinking, “May no one be troubled on my account.”

original: phyis spyod yul du 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: phyis spyod yul du 'gro bar byed de /
translated: He goes to his destination,

original: gang gi phyir sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed na spyod yul du mi 'gro zhing zan gcod pa'i bar du yang byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed na spyod yul du mi 'gro zhing zan gcod pa'i bar du yang byed do //
translated: because if his mind is troubled, he will not go to his destination, and he may even fast.

original: ji tsam na des bsam pa na bdag nyid klu las shi 'phos pa dang / gnyen rnams gdul byar gyur pa mthong ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na des bsam pa na bdag nyid klu las shi 'phos pa dang / gnyen rnams gdul byar gyur pa mthong ste /
translated: When he thinks about it, he sees that he died as a nāga and was reborn as a human, and that his relatives became his disciples.

original: ji tsam na klu'i khang par phyin te /
analyzed: ji tsam na klu'i khang par phyin te /
translated: Then he went to the nāga’s house.

original: klu'i rigs lnga brgya 'ongs pa dag btul te /
analyzed: klu'i rigs lnga brgya 'ongs pa dag btul te /

analyzed: de dag byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bkod de shing shal ma li'i nam mkha' lding gi gnod pa med par byas so //
translated: He established them in the meditative absorption of loving kindness and protected them from the harm of the garuḍas in the śālmalī forest.

original: ji tsam na gnas brtan gyis nam mkha' lding rnams gdul pa'i phyir klu'i rigs lnga brgya shing shal ma li'i steng du bteg ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na gnas brtan gyis nam mkha' lding rnams gdul pa'i phyir klu'i rigs lnga brgya shing shal ma li'i steng du bteg ste /
translated: Then the Elder, in order to tame the garuḍas, lifted up five hundred nāga families on the śālmali tree.

original: nam mkha' lding lnga brgya lnga brgya btul ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding lnga brgya lnga brgya btul ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He tamed five hundred garuḍas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das @61a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das @61a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One

original: kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: called out to the monks:

original: dge slong dag nga'i nyan thos nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi nang du mchog ni dge slong rab 'byor 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga'i nyan thos nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi nang du mchog ni dge slong rab 'byor 'di yin te /
translated: “Monks, among my disciples who abide in the absence of afflictions, this monk Subhūti is supreme.

original: las gang gis klur skyes she na /
analyzed: las gang gis klur skyes she na /
translated: What karma caused him to be born as a nāga?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la rigs kyi bu 'di rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la rigs kyi bu 'di rab tu byung ste /
translated: In the teachings of the Blessed Kāśyapa, this noble son went forth.

original: de'i mkhan po nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i mkhan po nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas te /
translated: His preceptor abided in the absence of afflictions.

original: des kyang nyon mongs pa med pa la dad pa thob po //
analyzed: des kyang nyon mongs pa med pa la dad pa thob po //
translated: He too attained faith in the absence of afflictions.🔽The young ones said,

original: des gzhon du rnams kyis rgod pa dang / bzlog pa dang / de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des gzhon du rnams kyis rgod pa dang / bzlog pa dang / de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: “We will not do so.”

original: 'di ni byams pa byams pa la gnas pa zhes smras pa dang / de khros nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ni byams pa byams pa la gnas pa zhes smras pa dang / de khros nas smras pa /
translated: When he became angry, he said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag ni sbrul dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag ni sbrul dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: “Venerable ones, you are like snakes.”

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four correct knowledges

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na 'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na 'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Monks, these four are the four correct knowledges.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang// nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The correct knowledge of meaning, the correct knowledge of phenomena, the correct knowledge of clear realization, and the correct knowledge of eloquence.”

original: btags pa'i ming dang gzugs btags pa las so so yang dag par rig pa 'di dag bshad do //
analyzed: btags pa'i ming dang gzugs btags pa las so so yang dag par rig pa 'di dag bshad do //
translated: These correct knowledges are explained in terms of the nominal designations of form and so on.

original: mngon shes rnam drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon shes rnam drug ces bya ba la /
translated: The six higher perceptions

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag mngon par shes pa ni drug ste /
translated: Monks, there are six higher perceptions.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i mig dang / rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i mig dang / rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge of the domain of supernatural powers, the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the mental activity of others, the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: 'o na rab tu byed pa las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na rab tu byed pa las zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that is so, then why does the Prakaraṇa say:

analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa'i yang dag par sdud pa'i rab tu byed pa las /
translated: In the Prakaraṇa that collects the lines of the treatise,

analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: it says, “What are the phenomena of higher perception?

original: shes rab dge ba ni mngon par shes pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: shes rab dge ba ni mngon par shes pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Virtuous wisdom is called higher perception

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin mngon par shes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it directly perceives the nature of all phenomena.”

original: gsum ni rig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum ni rig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three are called “clear knowledges.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: mi slob pa'i rig pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rig pa ni gsum ste /
