original: mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the awareness that manifests the knowledge of recollecting former abodes of the nonlearner, the knowledge of the awareness that manifests the knowledge of death and rebirth of the nonlearner, and the knowledge of the awareness that manifests the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants of the nonlearner.

original: sngon gyi @61b gnas rnams rig pa yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi @61b gnas rnams rig pa yis //
translated: By the knowledge of former abodes,

original: mtho ris ngan song gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: mtho ris ngan song gzigs nas ni //
translated: having seen high rebirth and lower rebirth,

original: de nas mngon shes nges pa yis //
analyzed: de nas mngon shes nges pa yis //
translated: then by the definite higher perceptions,

original: thub pa skye ba zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: thub pa skye ba zad par 'gyur //
translated: the Sage’s birth is exhausted.

original: kun las 'dod chags rnam grol zhing //
analyzed: kun las 'dod chags rnam grol zhing //
translated: Liberated from attachment to all,

original: sems ni 'dod chags grol zhes 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni 'dod chags grol zhes 'gyur //
translated: the mind is liberated from attachment.

original: rig pa gsum po phun tshogs pas //🔽de phyir gsum rig ces bya'o ;
analyzed: rig pa gsum po phun tshogs pas // de phyir gsum rig ces bya'o ;
translated: By perfecting the three knowledges,

original: ; zhes gsungs so //🔽cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: ; zhes gsungs so // cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: therefore he is called the one with three knowledges.

original: mdo drug gi tshogs kyi bzhi pa reg pa'i mdo las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo drug gi tshogs kyi bzhi pa reg pa'i mdo las 'byung ste /
translated: The three miracles are mentioned in the fourth chapter of the Collection of Six Discourses, the Discourse on Contact.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can stong rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ral pa can stong rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Then the Blessed One ordained the thousand dreadlocked ascetics and gave them full ordination.

original: ji ltar 'dod par nye bar gnas bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par nye bar gnas bar bya ste /
translated: He told them to stay wherever they liked.

original: ga ya mgo gang na ba der ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs te /
analyzed: ga ya mgo gang na ba der ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs te /
translated: He went wandering through the countryside and arrived at Gayāśīrṣa.

original: rim gyis ga ya mgor gshegs te /
analyzed: rim gyis ga ya mgor gshegs te /
translated: He gradually arrived at Gayāśīrṣa.

original: ga ya mgo'i aa shir sha'i mchod rten na dge slong stong tham pa dang / thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: ga ya mgo'i aa shir sha'i mchod rten na dge slong stong tham pa dang / thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: He stayed at the Aśirṣa stūpa in Gayāśīrṣa together with a thousand monks.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong stong rnams la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang ; rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis gdams par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong stong rnams la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum po rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang ; rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis gdams par mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One instructed the thousand monks with the three kinds of miracles: the miracle of supernatural power, the miracle of reading minds, and the miracle of teaching.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the Blessed One's miracle of supernatural power:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar thugs mnyam par gzhag pa na rang gi gdan las mi snang ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar thugs mnyam par gzhag pa na rang gi gdan las mi snang ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One entered into a samādhi such that, while remaining in equipoise, he disappeared from his seat.

original: shar phyogs su 'phos te spyod lam bzhi ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: shar phyogs su 'phos te spyod lam bzhi ston par mdzad de /
translated: He then moved to the east and displayed the four modes of conduct.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,

original: gshegs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzims pa dang / ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: gshegs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzims pa dang / ston par mdzad do //
translated: he walked, sat, stood, and lay down.

original: me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs shing me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las rnam pa du ma'i 'od dag 'phros te /
analyzed: me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs shing me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las rnam pa du ma'i 'od dag 'phros te /
translated: He entered the fire element and, having entered the fire element, emanated various lights from the body of the Blessed Buddha.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is to say,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / shel gyi kha dog lta bu dag 'byung ba'i cho 'phrul dag ston cing /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / shel gyi kha dog lta bu dag 'byung ba'i cho 'phrul dag ston cing /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, green, and crystal-colored lights appeared.

original: lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung zhing lus kyi smad nas 'bar ba dang / lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung zhing lus kyi stod nas 'bar bar byed de /
analyzed: lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung zhing lus kyi smad nas 'bar ba dang / lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'byung zhing lus kyi stod nas 'bar bar byed de /
translated: From the lower part of his body he emitted a stream of cold water, and from the upper part of his body he emitted fire.

original: shar phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang / de bzhin du nub dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs su yang ston par byed de /
analyzed: shar phyogs ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang / de bzhin du nub dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs su yang ston par byed de /
translated: In the same way he showed his magical power in the south, in the west, and in the north.

original: phyogs bzhir steng dang 'og tu rdzu 'phrul bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir steng dang 'og tu rdzu 'phrul bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Having shown his magical power in the four directions, above and below,

original: de nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba ni de dag slar btul @62a * //
analyzed: de nas rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba ni de dag slar btul @62a * //
translated: he withdrew his magical power.

original: te ; dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs te /
analyzed: te ; dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun du gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs te /
translated: He sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: This is the Blessed One’s magical power.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te /🔽dge slong dag khyed kyi sems ni 'di lta bu /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di yin te / dge slong dag khyed kyi sems ni 'di lta bu /
translated: As for the Blessed One’s power of reading others’ minds,🔽he said, “Monks, your mind is like this,

original: yid ni 'di lta bu ;
analyzed: yid ni 'di lta bu ;
translated: your thoughts are like this,

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'di lta bu ste /
translated: Consciousness is like this.

original: 'di lta bur rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta bur rtog par byed do //
translated: One should think like this.

original: 'di lta bur rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta bur rtog par mi byed do //
translated: One should not think like this.

original: 'di ltar yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid la byed do //
translated: One should pay attention like this.

original: 'di ltar yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid la mi byed do //
translated: One should not pay attention like this.

original: 'di ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spangs pa'o //
translated: This is abandoned.

original: 'di ni lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is realized by the body and then accomplished and maintained.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //

translated: and “it is not the case that they do not describe the mind on the basis of a reason or an explanation, or that they do not describe the mind after hearing it from gods or humans.

original: 'on kyang yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pas sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi yid yid kyis rnam par shes nas yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas /🔽snga ma bzhin du thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pas sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan rnams kyi yid yid kyis rnam par shes nas yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas / snga ma bzhin du thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi / gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: However, after knowing the mind of another being or person through mental consciousness, they describe the mind, saying, ‘The mind is like this’ and so on up to ‘it is not the case that all of them are like that.

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze rgyu mtshan nam /🔽yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze rgyu mtshan nam / yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is not the case that they do not describe the mind on the basis of a reason or an explanation, or that they do not describe the mind after hearing it from gods or humans.

original: snga ma bzhin du thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi / gzhan du ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: However, after knowing the mind of another being or person through mental consciousness, they describe the mind, saying, ‘The mind is like this’ and so on up to ‘it is not the case that all of them are like that.

original: dad pa'i khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: dad pa'i khyim bdag gam /
translated: It is not the case that they do not describe the mind on the basis of a reason or an explanation, or that they do not describe the mind after hearing it from gods or humans.🔽However, after knowing the mind of another being or person through mental consciousness, they describe the mind, saying, ‘The mind is like this’ and so on up to ‘it is not the case that all of them are like that.

original: khyim bdag gi bu dag gis mthong ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu dag gis mthong ste /
translated: The sons of the householders saw this.

original: mthong nas ma dad pa'i khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi bu de dag la 'di skad du kye skyes bu dag shes par gyis shig /'di na dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun brjod ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: mthong nas ma dad pa'i khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi bu de dag la 'di skad du kye skyes bu dag shes par gyis shig /'di na dge sbyong ngam / bram ze rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun brjod ces bya ba nas /
translated: Having seen it, they said to the householders or sons of householders who lacked faith, “Hey, you should know that here, from the reasons or explanations of the śramaṇas

original: thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: or brahmins, the mind is like this, and so on up to ‘it is all like that,

original: gzhan du yang ma @64a * //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ma @64a * //
translated: and it is not otherwise.’🔽I have seen it.”

original: yin pa ngas mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang / kye skyes bu khyod kyis dge sbyong ngam bram ze rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun brjod ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: yin pa ngas mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang / kye skyes bu khyod kyis dge sbyong ngam bram ze rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun brjod ces bya ba nas /
translated: “Hey, you, what is so amazing about seeing that from the reasons or explanations of the śramaṇas or brahmins, the mind is like this, and so on up to ‘it is all like that,

original: thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan du ma yin pa mthong ba la ngo mtshar ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan du ma yin pa mthong ba la ngo mtshar ba ci zhig yod /
translated: and it is not otherwise’?

original: kye skyes bu rtog byed ces bya ba'i rig sngags yod de gang zhig gis bzung zhing bcangs nas rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun rjod par byed ces bya ba nas thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma
analyzed: kye skyes bu rtog byed ces bya ba'i rig sngags yod de gang zhig gis bzung zhing bcangs nas rgyu mtshan nam yongs su brjod pa las yid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes kun rjod par byed ces bya ba nas thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma
translated: O man, there is a knowledge mantra called the creator. Whoever holds and recites it will be able to say, “My mind is like this” and all will be just so.🔽

original: yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: yin no zhes smra na /
translated: “O man, there is a knowledge-mantra called ‘the creator.’ If someone holds and recites it, they will be able to say, ‘My mind is like this,’ and so on, and everything will happen as they say, not otherwise.”🔽“

original: khyim bdag gi bu 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽gnas gnyis pa 'di la dad pa'i khyim bdag gam /🔽khyim bdag gi bu de dag ma dad pa'i khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu 'di ji snyam du sems / gnas gnyis pa 'di la dad pa'i khyim bdag gam / khyim bdag gi bu de dag ma dad pa'i khyim bdag gam /
translated: Householder’s son, what do you think?🔽Will the faithful householders🔽or the faithful sons of householders listen to the explanations of those householders

original: khyim bdag gi bu de dag gi nye bar brjod pa nyan snyam sems sam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu de dag gi nye bar brjod pa nyan snyam sems sam /
translated: or sons of householders who lack faith in this second case?”

original: btsun pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa de bzhin no //
translated: “Venerable One, it is just so.”

original: khyim bdag gi bu mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu ngas yang dag par rjes su gzigs nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu ngas yang dag par rjes su gzigs nas /
translated: “Householder’s son, I have seen with my own eyes the faults of such a display of supernormal knowledge that surpasses human abilities.

original: dge slong dag dge ba ni gsang bar bya zhing sdig pa ni mthol bar bya'o zhes nyan thos rnams la chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge ba ni gsang bar bya zhing sdig pa ni mthol bar bya'o zhes nyan thos rnams la chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: Bhikṣus, virtue should be concealed, and evil should be confessed.

original: khyim bdag gi bu rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the miracle of instruction for a householder?

original: khyim bdag gi bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gnas rnam pa gsum rnams la ston pa'i yongs su dag pa btsal bar bya'o zhes de'i dpe tshul khrims kyi phung po'i
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung zhes bya ba nas rgyas par gnas rnam pa gsum rnams la ston pa'i yongs su dag pa btsal bar bya'o zhes de'i dpe tshul khrims kyi phung po'i
translated: Householder, when a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha appears in the world, one should seek the purification of the three abodes in detail, as stated in the Sūtra on the Aggregate of Virtue.

original: bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdo lnga ba'i stod kyi cha las 'byung la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdo lnga ba'i stod kyi cha las 'byung la /
translated: The first part of the Sūtra on the Aggregate of Virtue in Five Parts appears in the Sūtra on Concentration and Superknowledge,

original: smad kyi cha ni mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par tshangs pa'i bar du g-yo sgyu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba der bris zin to //
analyzed: smad kyi cha ni mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par tshangs pa'i bar du g-yo sgyu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba der bris zin to //
translated: and the second part has already been written in the second chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, where it says up to deception and fraud occur up to Brahmā.

original: ston pa la /
analyzed: ston pa la /
translated: To the Teacher,

original: yid mgyogs 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid mgyogs 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Swift-Witted One

original: bcom ldan 'das shar sha pa'i grong khyer gyi tsan dan gyi khang pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shar sha pa'i grong khyer gyi tsan dan gyi khang pa na bzhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavān was dwelling in the sandalwood house in the city of Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma zhes bya ba gnyis gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma zhes bya ba gnyis gnas te /
translated: At that time, in the great ocean, there were two nāga kings named Kṛṣṇa and Gautama who lived there.

original: bcom ldan 'das shar sha pa'i grong khyer na chos ston gyis nyan pa'i phyir 'gro'o zhes gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shar sha pa'i grong khyer na chos ston gyis nyan pa'i phyir 'gro'o zhes gnas te /
translated: They thought, The Bhagavān is teaching the Dharma in the city of Śrāvastī. Let us go to listen!

original: de nas klu lnga brgya'i 'khor dang / chu bo lnga brgya nas byung ste shar sha pa'i grong khyer du 'ong ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @64b kyi chos rnams la mi brjed pa'i dran pas klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma gnyis shar sha ba'i grong khyer du 'ongs na grong khyer gzhig cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba gzigs te /
analyzed: de nas klu lnga brgya'i 'khor dang / chu bo lnga brgya nas byung ste shar sha pa'i grong khyer du 'ong ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @64b kyi chos rnams la mi brjed pa'i dran pas klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma gnyis shar sha ba'i grong khyer du 'ongs na grong khyer gzhig cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba gzigs te /
translated: Then, with an entourage of five hundred nāgas and five hundred rivers, they emerged and came to the city of Śrāvastī. The Bhagavān Buddha saw that if the nāga kings Kṛṣṇa and Gautama came to the city of Śrāvastī, the city would be destroyed and disappear due to his undeluded mindfulness of the Buddha's teachings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana:

original: mood gal gyi bu chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i glo bur ba'i bsod snyoms dag zung shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i glo bur ba'i bsod snyoms dag zung shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, receive the Tathāgata's occasional alms. Why is that?

original: mood gal gyi bu chen po glo bur gyi bsod snyoms ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu chen po glo bur gyi bsod snyoms ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, occasional alms are of five kinds:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: glo bur du lhags pa dang / mgron po dang / nad pa dang / nad g-yog dang / las byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: glo bur du lhags pa dang / mgron po dang / nad pa dang / nad g-yog dang / las byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those of the newly arrived, travelers, the sick, nurses, and workers.

original: 'don 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'don 'di la bcom ldan 'das nyid las byed pa yin no //
translated: In this recitation, the Blessed One himself is the worker.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dang / mood gal gyi bu thabs cig tu klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma gnyis gang na ba der gshegs shing nye bar gshegs te bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dang / mood gal gyi bu thabs cig tu klu'i rgyal po nag po dang / goo ta ma gnyis gang na ba der gshegs shing nye bar gshegs te bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One and Maudgalyāyana went together to where the nāga kings Kāla and Godatta were, and said:

original: klu'i dbang po dag shur pa ri'i grong khyer mi snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bsam par gyis shig / de gnyis kyis smras pa /🔽btsun pa dad pa'i shugs de 'dra bas bdag cag der 'ongs na gang yang bdag srog chags grog sbur yan chad la yang gnod par mi nus na /
analyzed: klu'i dbang po dag shur pa ri'i grong khyer mi snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bsam par gyis shig / de gnyis kyis smras pa / btsun pa dad pa'i shugs de 'dra bas bdag cag der 'ongs na gang yang bdag srog chags grog sbur yan chad la yang gnod par mi nus na /
translated: They said,

original: shur sha pa na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
analyzed: shur sha pa na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
translated: “Venerable, if we came here with such a powerful faith, we would not be able to harm even an ant, let alone the people living in Śuṃbha.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdugs tshod gsol bar rtsom pa na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdugs tshod gsol bar rtsom pa na /
translated: Then, when the Blessed One was about to eat his meal,

original: klu de dag so so nas 'di snyam du kye ma bcom ldan 'das bdag gi chu gsol bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems so //
analyzed: klu de dag so so nas 'di snyam du kye ma bcom ldan 'das bdag gi chu gsol bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems so //
translated: each of the nāgas thought, “Oh, may the Blessed One drink from my water.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: gal te gcig gi chu 'thungs na gzhan dag mi dga' bar 'gyur gyis thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: gal te gcig gi chu 'thungs na gzhan dag mi dga' bar 'gyur gyis thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o zhes dgongs te /
translated: “If I drink from one’s water, the others will be displeased. I will do something about this.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One called to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana:🔽“Maudgalyāyana, take a bowl of water from where the five hundred rivers converge.”

original: mood gal gyi bu chu lnga brgya gang du 'dus pa de las chu lhung bzed gang khyer la shog shig / btsun pa de bzhin no zhes tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu chu lnga brgya gang du 'dus pa de las chu lhung bzed gang khyer la shog shig / btsun pa de bzhin no zhes tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
translated: “Yes, Bhadanta,” the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana replied to the Blessed One.

original: chu bo lnga brgya gang du 'dus pa de las chu lhung bzed gang blangs te /
analyzed: chu bo lnga brgya gang du 'dus pa de las chu lhung bzed gang blangs te /
translated: He took a bowl of water from where the five hundred rivers converge

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la chu lhung bzed bkang nas phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis blangs te gsol to //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal @65a * //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das la chu lhung bzed bkang nas phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis blangs te gsol to // de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal @65a * //
translated: Having approached, he offered the Blessed One a bowl full of water, and the Blessed One accepted it and drank.

original: gyi bu chen po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gyi bu chen po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana thought this:

original: sngon bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag pha dang / ma dag ni bu la dka' ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: sngon bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag pha dang / ma dag ni bu la dka' ba byed pa ste /
translated: “Previously the Blessed One said, ‘Monks, mothers and fathers are difficult to repay,

original: gsos skyed par byed cing 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs ston pa ste /🔽phrag pa gcig la pha /
analyzed: gsos skyed par byed cing 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs ston pa ste / phrag pa gcig la pha /
translated: He nourished them and showed them the various things of the world.🔽He carried his father on one shoulder

original: phrag pa gnyis pa la ma khyer te /
analyzed: phrag pa gnyis pa la ma khyer te /
translated: and his mother on the other shoulder.

original: lo 'khor ba brgyar gnas pa dang / gang yang sa chen po 'di'i nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / shel dang / gser dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram dang / aasma garbha dang / mu sa la garbha dang /
analyzed: lo 'khor ba brgyar gnas pa dang / gang yang sa chen po 'di'i nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / shel dang / gser dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram dang / aasma garbha dang / mu sa la garbha dang /
translated: He lived for a hundred years and made this great earth rich with jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystal, gold, silver, refined gold, emeralds, musāragalva,

original: lo he ta r'a ga dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa 'di lta bu rnams kyis phyug par byas kyang bus pha dang ma la phan pa byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lo he ta r'a ga dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa 'di lta bu rnams kyis phyug par byas kyang bus pha dang ma la phan pa byas pa ma yin no //
translated: lohita, right-turning conch shells, and so on. But the son did not benefit his father and mother.

original: gang gis pha dang ma ma dad pa dad pa phun sum tshogs par byed cing 'dul ba dang / rab tu 'god pa dang / rab tu 'jog par byed cing tshul khrims 'chal ba tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ser sna can gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis pha dang ma ma dad pa dad pa phun sum tshogs par byed cing 'dul ba dang / rab tu 'god pa dang / rab tu 'jog par byed cing tshul khrims 'chal ba tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ser sna can gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: to be established, and to be settled, and causes those with poor moral discipline to become endowed with perfect moral discipline, and causes the miserly to become endowed with perfect generosity,

original: shes rab 'chal ba shes rab phun sum tshogs par byed cing 'dul ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / rab tu 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba shes rab phun sum tshogs par byed cing 'dul ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / rab tu 'jog par byed na /
translated: and causes those with poor wisdom to become endowed with perfect wisdom, and causes them to be disciplined, to be established, and to be settled,

original: 'di tsam gyis bus pha dang ma la phan ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis bus pha dang ma la phan ba byas pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: to this extent a child has benefited their parents.”

original: bdag gis ma la phan pa cung zad kyang ma byas kyis da bdag gis ma gang du skyes pa bsam par bya'o zhes des bsams pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can du skyes par mthong zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis ma la phan pa cung zad kyang ma byas kyis da bdag gis ma gang du skyes pa bsam par bya'o zhes des bsams pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can du skyes par mthong zhing /
translated: “I have not benefited my mother in the least. Now I will think about where my mother has been born.” He thought and saw that she had been born in the world system Maricī.

original: gang gis 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'dul zhe na /
translated: “By whom is she to be disciplined?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul bar mthong nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul bar mthong nas /
translated: He saw that she was to be disciplined by the Blessed One.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag thag ring po nas 'ongs par gyur la bdag gis don 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag thag ring po nas 'ongs par gyur la bdag gis don 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs par bya'o zhes /
translated: He thought, “I have come from far away, and I must make the Blessed One understand this matter.”

original: des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon dge slong dag pha dang ma bu la dka' ba byed pa ste zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon dge slong dag pha dang ma bu la dka' ba byed pa ste zhes gsungs na /
translated: “Lord, the Blessed One has said that parents are a child’s refuge,

original: bdag gi ma 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can du skyes pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bar 'os te /
analyzed: bdag gi ma 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can du skyes pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bar 'os te /
translated: but my mother has been born in the world system of Marici. She is worthy of being guided by the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung ste de gdul bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung ste de gdul bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please guide her with your great compassion.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mood gal gyi bu gang gi rdzu 'phrul @65b gyis 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu gang gi rdzu 'phrul @65b gyis 'gro bar bya /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, by whose miraculous power will you go?”

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi 'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi 'o //
translated: “By the Blessed One’s, Lord.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dang tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po ri rab kyi steng du zhabs 'jog cing gshegs te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byams pa'i phyag gis rus pa'i tshogs bsnams te chos ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed Maitreya will take up the Blessed One’s bones with his own hands and teach the Dharma.

original: chos ston ba thos nas nyan thos bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes phren tshegs las /🔽dbyangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sman gyi gzhi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las rgyas par 'don to //
analyzed: chos ston ba thos nas nyan thos bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes phren tshegs las / dbyangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sman gyi gzhi'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las rgyas par 'don to //
translated: and when they hear the teaching, 9.6 million śrāvakas will manifest arhatship.🔽This is stated in the Sutra on the Three Summaries of the Dharma.🔽This concludes the seventh chapter of the Treasury of Abhidharma,

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba zhes bya ba las mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba zhes bya ba las mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: called “The Aggregates, Bases, and Elements,” which extensively explains the third summary of the Dharma.

original: // /'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // /'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The training of the mind is superior to the training in ethics.

original: lam gyi tshogs kyi bslab pa'i sgo'i mdo gsum pa dang bzhi pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa 'di nyid du /🔽de'i tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs kyi bslab pa'i sgo'i mdo gsum pa dang bzhi pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa 'di nyid du / de'i tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
translated: This is stated in the Sutra on the Three Gates of Training for the Path, the third and fourth of which are found in this sixth chapter of the Treasury.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, they are nonlearners, arhats.

original: @67b tshig le'ur byas pa dang / yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin zhes bris zin to //
analyzed: @67b tshig le'ur byas pa dang / yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin zhes bris zin to //
translated: and the verses, and also the morality, concentration, and wisdom.🔽The chief of the pure mental states

original: sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The chief of the pure mental states is faith.

original: stag gi byang chub kyi bu dang / nyan thos kyi rnam par bshad pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig pa'i tha ma las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas drug par bshad zin to //
analyzed: stag gi byang chub kyi bu dang / nyan thos kyi rnam par bshad pa sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig pa'i tha ma las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas drug par bshad zin to //
translated: The son of the Sage, the Sravaka, and the eleven verses of the Vinaya are explained in the sixth chapter of the Abhidharmakośa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Blessed One also said, “There are also unwholesome concentrations.”

original: tshangs pa'i tshogs kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i mood gal gyi bu dang sbas pa'i mdo las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i tshogs kyi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i mood gal gyi bu dang sbas pa'i mdo las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: In the first verse of the Brahma-parṣat-samyutta, Maudgalyāyana and the hidden sūtra are recited like this:

original: de'i tshe na sde dpon nye dga' 'khor der 'dus par gyur cing tshogs te 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na sde dpon nye dga' 'khor der 'dus par gyur cing tshogs te 'dug par gyur te /
translated: At that time, the general Upāli was present in that assembly, and he was sitting in the assembly.

original: de nas sde dpon nye dgas chen por grags pa'i bram ze 'char byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas sde dpon nye dgas chen por grags pa'i bram ze 'char byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the general Nyagrodha said to the famous brahmin Udayi,

original: 'char byed khyed cag 'ong ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na de ltar bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi tshul gyis mngon par dga' ba bden nam /
analyzed: 'char byed khyed cag 'ong ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na de ltar bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi tshul gyis mngon par dga' ba bden nam /
translated: “Udayi, is it true that you and your followers, in the Kālaka grove, delight in meditation and the way of meditation?”

original: sde dpon de de bzhin te /
analyzed: sde dpon de de bzhin te /
translated: “General, it is so, it is true.

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you say.

original: bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi tshul gyis sdom par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bsam gtan gyi tshul gyis sdom par byed do //
translated: We are restrained by meditation and the way of meditation.”

original: dus gcig gi tshe bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma chu bo can byi kun dze ka'i spyil bu na bzhugs te /
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma chu bo can byi kun dze ka'i spyil bu na bzhugs te /
translated: At one time, the Blessed Gautama was dwelling in the hut of the riverbank.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma des bdag la bsam gtan thams cad ni bsngags shing bsam gtan thams cad kyi rab tu bsngags pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma des bdag la bsam gtan thams cad ni bsngags shing bsam gtan thams cad kyi rab tu bsngags pa gsung ngo //
translated: At that time, the Blessed Gautama praised all meditations and highly praised all meditations for me.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos chen por grags pa'i bram ze 'char byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos chen por grags pa'i bram ze 'char byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Ananda said this to the famous brahmin Udayi,

original: 'char byed khyod 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma des bdag la bsam gtan thams cad bsngags shing bsam gtan thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa gsung ngo zhes ma smra shig /'on kyang bcom ldan 'das ni bsngags par mi 'os pa de dag gi bsngags
analyzed: 'char byed khyod 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma des bdag la bsam gtan thams cad bsngags shing bsam gtan thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa gsung ngo zhes ma smra shig /'on kyang bcom ldan 'das ni bsngags par mi 'os pa de dag gi bsngags
translated: “Udayin, do not say that the Bhagavān Gautama praises all meditative absorptions and extols all meditative absorptions.

original: pa mi gsung gi / bsngags par 'os pa dag gi bsngags pa mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: pa mi gsung gi / bsngags par 'os pa dag gi bsngags pa mi gsung ngo //
translated: The Bhagavān does not praise those who are not worthy of praise, but he praises those who are worthy of praise.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma gang bsngags par mi 'os pa dag gi bsngags pa mi gsung zhe na /🔽'char byed 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems la lan mang du gnas shing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i @68a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das goo ta ma gang bsngags par mi 'os pa dag gi bsngags pa mi gsung zhe na / 'char byed 'di na kha cig 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems la lan mang du gnas shing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i @68a * //
translated: “Udayin, why does the Bhagavān Gautama not praise those who are not worthy of praise?🔽Udayin, some people here dwell frequently in a mind that is completely bound up with sensual desire, and they do not know as it really is

original: skyes pa rnams la phyis nges pa 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams la phyis nges pa 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
translated: the escape from a mind that is completely bound up with sensual desire.

original: de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas bar du bcad cing sgom par byed rab tu bsgom zhing bsgom ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pas bar du bcad cing sgom par byed rab tu bsgom zhing bsgom ste /
translated: He cultivates and develops that meditation, and is bound by attachment to sense pleasures.

original: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pas sems la lan mang du gnas shing the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams las /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pas sems la lan mang du gnas shing the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pa skyes pa rnams las /
translated: He is often bound by malice, torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt, and his mind is often bound by the arising of doubt.

original: phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
analyzed: phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
translated: He does not know the way out of that as it really is.

original: de the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pas rab tu bcad cing sgom par byed /
analyzed: de the tshom gyis kun nas dkris pas rab tu bcad cing sgom par byed /
translated: He cultivates and develops that meditation, and is bound by doubt.

original: rab tu bsgom zhing bsgom ste /
analyzed: rab tu bsgom zhing bsgom ste /
translated: He cultivates and develops that meditation.

original: 'di ltar na bsngags par ma 'os pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsngags pa mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar na bsngags par ma 'os pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsngags pa mi gsung ngo //
translated: In this way, he does not praise the meditation that is not worthy of praise.

original: ji ltar na bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsung zhe na /
translated: “How does he praise the meditation that is worthy of praise?

original: 'char byed 'di na dge slong 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba las dben zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: 'char byed 'di na dge slong 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba las dben zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: “Udayin, a monk here who is secluded from sense pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, and who has properly undertaken the meditation that is worthy of praise,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the fourth concentration.

original: 'di ltar na bsngags par 'os pa bsngags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar na bsngags par 'os pa bsngags so //
translated: Thus, the praiseworthy is praised.

original: kun dga' po bcom ldan 'das goo ta mas bsngags par mi 'os pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsngags pa mi gsung zhing /
analyzed: kun dga' po bcom ldan 'das goo ta mas bsngags par mi 'os pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsngags pa mi gsung zhing /
translated: Ananda, the Bhagavat Gautama does not praise the concentrations that are not praiseworthy.

original: bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsung ngam /
analyzed: bsngags par 'os pa'i bsngags pa gsung ngam /
translated: He praises the concentrations that are praiseworthy.

original: kun dga' bo bdag la yang bya ba mang po dang bya ba mang du mchis kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo bdag la yang bya ba mang po dang bya ba mang du mchis kyis 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Ananda, I also have many duties and much to do, so I will go.🔽Udayi, if you know that the time has come, then go.

original: 'char byed de ltar de'i dus la bab par shes na song shig / de nas chen por grags pa'i ma ga dh'a'i bram ze 'char byed tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: 'char byed de ltar de'i dus la bab par shes na song shig / de nas chen por grags pa'i ma ga dh'a'i bram ze 'char byed tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bshad pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: Then the Magadhan brahmin Maha-Kasyapa, having rejoiced in and delighted in the words of the Venerable Ananda,

original: stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stan las langs te song ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: rose from his seat and departed.

original: gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te tshe dang drod gnyis 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is said that life and heat are mixed,

original: lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mthar gsus po che'i mdo las byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa 'di nyid du /
analyzed: lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i mthar gsus po che'i mdo las byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum pa 'di nyid du /
translated: The third verse of the summary of the medium length discourses states:🔽The six feelings that arise from that

original: de las byung ba'i tshor ba drug / lnga ni lus kyi'o sems kyi gzhan //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshor ba drug / lnga ni lus kyi'o sems kyi gzhan //
translated: are five of the body and the sixth of mind.

original: zhes bya bar tshe dang drod gnyis lhan cig cing 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma nges par grub po zhes bya bar bris zin to /
analyzed: zhes bya bar tshe dang drod gnyis lhan cig cing 'dres par gsungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma nges par grub po zhes bya bar bris zin to /
translated: This is written in the third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, and since it states that life and heat are simultaneous and mixed, it is definitely established that they are momentary.

original: // /'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // /'dam bu'i shog gnyis bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like two pieces of reed matting,

original: gleng gzhi @68b ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi @68b ni rgyal po'i khab na'o //
translated: the setting is Rājagṛha.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che gnyis rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la brten te gnas to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che gnyis rgyal po'i khab kyi bya rgod phung po'i ri la brten te gnas to //
translated: At that time the venerable Śāriputra and the venerable Pūrṇa were staying on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dgongs ka nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te /
translated: Then in the evening the venerable Śāriputra rose from his meditation and said to the venerable Pūrṇa:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: He approached the venerable Pūrṇa.

original: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba ngang yang dag par bde ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dang lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba ngang yang dag par bde ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he exchanged courteous greetings with the venerable Pūrṇa. After exchanging courteous greetings and pleasant conversation, he sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Having sat down to one side, the venerable Śāriputra said this to the venerable Pūrṇa:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dris pa lung bstan pa'i phyir skabs su 'byed na bdag phyogs cung zad cig yongs su 'dri'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dris pa lung bstan pa'i phyir skabs su 'byed na bdag phyogs cung zad cig yongs su 'dri'o //
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, if you would give me the opportunity, I would ask you about a certain point, out of respect for the Dharma.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dris shig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dris shig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, ask whatever you wish. Having heard it, I will know.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rga ba yod dam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rga ba yod dam /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, is there old age?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yod do ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yod do ;
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, there is.”

original: /'chi ba yod dam /
analyzed: /'chi ba yod dam /
translated: “Is there death?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yod do //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, there is.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci rga ba dang 'chi ba dag rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci rga ba dang 'chi ba dag rang gis byas sam /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, is aging and death created by oneself,

original: gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: created by another,

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: created both by oneself and by another,

original: 'on te rga ba dang 'chi ba dag rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med par byung /
analyzed: 'on te rga ba dang 'chi ba dag rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med par byung /
translated: or do aging and death arise without a cause, not created by oneself or another?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rga ba dang 'chi ba ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rga ba dang 'chi ba ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, aging and death are not created by oneself, nor are they created by another.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: They are not created both by oneself and by another,

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba dag ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las kyang ma byung gi /'on kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang 'chi ba byung ngo /
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba dag ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las kyang ma byung gi /'on kyang skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang 'chi ba byung ngo /
translated: nor do aging and death arise without a cause, not created by oneself or another. However, aging and death occur due to the condition of birth.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci skye ba rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci skye ba rang gis byas sam /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, is birth created by oneself,

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: or is it created by another?”

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: Or is it produced by both oneself and another?

original: skye ba dang rga ba dag rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dag rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: Or is birth and aging not produced by oneself or another, but arise without a cause?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye ba ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, birth is not produced by oneself, nor is it produced by another.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not produced by both oneself and another,

original: skye ba ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //🔽'on kyang srid pa'i @69a * //
analyzed: skye ba ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin no // 'on kyang srid pa'i @69a * //
translated: nor is birth not produced by oneself or another, but arises without a cause.

original: rkyen gyis skye ba byung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen gyis skye ba byung ngo //
translated: However, Venerable Pūrṇa, birth occurs due to the condition of existence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci srid pa rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ci srid pa rang gis byas sam /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, is existence produced by oneself?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: Or is it produced by another?

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: Or is it produced by both oneself and another?

original: 'on te srid pa rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: 'on te srid pa rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: Or is existence not produced by oneself or another, but arises without a cause?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu srid pa ni rang gis kyang ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /🔽rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu srid pa ni rang gis kyang ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la / rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, existence is not produced by itself, nor is it produced by another.🔽It is not produced by both itself and another,

analyzed: srid pa ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /

analyzed: 'on kyang srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa byung ngo //

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che srid pa rang gis byas sam /

analyzed: 'on te sred pa rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sred pa ni rang gis kyang ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, craving is not produced by itself or by another.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not produced by both itself and another.

original: sred pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa byung ngo //
translated: However, craving occurs due to the condition of feeling.

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che tshor ba rang gis byas sam //

analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: or are they produced both by oneself and by another,

analyzed: 'on te tshor ba rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: or are feelings produced without a cause, not produced by oneself or another?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshor ba ni rang gis kyang ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshor ba ni rang gis kyang ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, feelings are not produced by oneself, nor are they produced by another,

original: rang gis byas pa yang ma yin gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa yang ma yin gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: nor are they produced both by oneself and by another,

original: tshor ba rang gis ma byas @69b gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba rang gis ma byas @69b gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: nor are feelings produced without a cause, not produced by oneself or another.

original: 'on kyang rig pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang rig pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba byung ngo //
translated: However, feelings arise due to the condition of contact.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che reg pa rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che reg pa rang gis byas sam /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, is contact produced by oneself,

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: or is it produced by another,

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: or is it produced both by oneself and by another,🔽or is contact produced without a cause, not produced by oneself or another?”

original: 'on te reg pa dang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: 'on te reg pa dang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: Or is contact not produced by itself, not produced by another, not produced by both itself and another, and not produced by its own power, not transformed by the power of another, and not produced by chance, not transformed by the power of another, and not produced without a cause?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu reg pa ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /🔽rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu reg pa ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la / rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, contact is not produced by itself, not produced by another, not produced by both itself and another,

original: reg pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and not produced by its own power, not transformed by the power of another, and not produced by chance, not transformed by the power of another, and not produced without a cause.

original: 'on kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa byung ngo //
translated: However, contact occurs due to the condition of the six sense bases.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che skye mched drug rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che skye mched drug rang gis byas sam /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, are the six sense bases produced by oneself,

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: or are they produced by another,

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing /🔽gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing / gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: or are they produced by both oneself and another,

original: 'on te skye mched drug rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: 'on te skye mched drug rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: or are the six sense bases not produced by oneself, not produced by another, not produced by both oneself and another, and not produced without a cause?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye mched drug ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu skye mched drug ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the six sense sources are not self-produced, nor are they produced by others.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis ma byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis ma byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: They are not produced by themselves and not produced by others.

original: skye mched drug ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The six sense sources are not uncaused, nor are they produced by God, nor are they produced by any combination of these.

original: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug byung ngo //
translated: However, the six sense sources arise with name-and-form as their condition.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ming dang gzugs rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ming dang gzugs rang gis byas sam /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, is name-and-form self-produced,

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: or is it produced by others,

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /
translated: or is it produced by both itself and others,

original: ming dang gzugs rang gis ma byas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rang gis ma byas /
translated: or is name-and-form not produced by itself,

original: gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: not produced by others, and not uncaused?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, name-and-form is not self-produced, nor is it produced by others,

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not that it is produced by itself or by another.

original: ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Name and form are not uncaused, in that they are not produced by themselves or by another.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs byung ngo //
translated: Name and form arise with consciousness as their condition.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rnam par shes pa rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che rnam par shes pa rang gis byas sam /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, is consciousness produced by itself?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: Or is it produced by another?

original: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam /🔽'on te rnam par shes pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang @70a * //
analyzed: 'on te rang gis kyang byas shing gzhan gyis kyang byas sam / 'on te rnam par shes pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang @70a * //
translated: Or is it produced both by itself and by another?

original: ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
analyzed: ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung /
translated: Or is consciousness unproduced, not produced by itself or by another, and not arisen from a cause?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par shes pa ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam par shes pa ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis kyang ma byas la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, consciousness is not produced by itself or by another.

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not produced both by itself and by another, nor is it unproduced, not produced by itself or by another, and not arisen from a cause.

original: rnam par shes pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not produced by itself, nor is it produced by another, nor is it produced without a cause.

original: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa byung ngo //
translated: However, consciousness arises with name-and-form as its condition.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che snga mas phyi ma dang / phyi mas snga ma 'di ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che snga mas phyi ma dang / phyi mas snga ma 'di ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, how could the latter be logically related to the former, and how could the former be logically related to the latter?

original: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ltar tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches 'di skad du /
translated: In this way, Venerable Pūrṇa said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ming dang gzugs ni rang gis ma byas shing gzhan gyis ma byas la /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, name-and-form is not produced by itself, nor is it produced by another,

original: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: nor is it produced by itself and by another,

original: ming dang gzugs rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rang gis ma byas gzhan gyis ma byas par rgyu med pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is name-and-form produced without a cause.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs byung ngo zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs byung ngo zhes bshad pa la /
translated: However, name-and-form arises with consciousness as its condition.”

original: da ltar ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa byung ngo zhes tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches bshad pa'i don mi shes te /
analyzed: da ltar ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa byung ngo zhes tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches bshad pa'i don mi shes te /
translated: Now, I do not understand the meaning of what the Venerable Pūrṇa has explained, namely, ‘Consciousness arises with name-and-form as its condition.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches bshad pa'i don 'di ji ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po ches bshad pa'i don 'di ji ltar blta bar bya /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, how should I understand the meaning of what you have explained?🔽Therefore, Venerable Śāriputra, since wise people understand the meaning of what is explained through parables, listen to a parable for the time being.

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus skyes bu mkhas pa rnams ni dpes rnam par bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur bas re zhig dpe nyon cig / dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis blang ba dag phan tshun bsten cing phan tshun 'brel ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus skyes bu mkhas pa rnams ni dpes rnam par bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur bas re zhig dpe nyon cig / dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis blang ba dag phan tshun bsten cing phan tshun 'brel ba dang /
translated: For example, two pieces of reed are mutually supported, mutually connected,

original: phan tshun bsten cing gnas te /
analyzed: phan tshun bsten cing gnas te /
translated: and mutually supported and abiding.

original: de las 'ga' zhig gis gcig blangs nas gnyis pa lhung bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de las 'ga' zhig gis gcig blangs nas gnyis pa lhung bar gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: If someone takes away one of them, the other falls down.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ches gnyis po 'di dag ni phan tshun bsten pa phan tshun 'brel ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ches gnyis po 'di dag ni phan tshun bsten pa phan tshun 'brel ba /
translated: In the same way, Venerable Śāriputra, these two things mutually support each other, mutually connect with each other,

original: phan tshun bsten cing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun bsten cing gnas pa ste /
translated: and mutually support and abide.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin zhing /
translated: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: Name and form are a condition for consciousness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ji ltar ston pa'i kan thos mkhas pa gsal ba dul ba 'jigs pa med pa 'chi ba med pa dang / 'chi ba med pa'i khams lus kyis mngon sum byas shing bsgrubs te gnas pa dag gis 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin zab cing zab pa'i dris pa dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas lung bstan pa @70b legs so legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ji ltar ston pa'i kan thos mkhas pa gsal ba dul ba 'jigs pa med pa 'chi ba med pa dang / 'chi ba med pa'i khams lus kyis mngon sum byas shing bsgrubs te gnas pa dag gis 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin zab cing zab pa'i dris pa dag yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas lung bstan pa @70b legs so legs so //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, just as the learned, clear, disciplined, fearless, and immortal disciples of the Teacher, who have actualized and accomplished the immortal realm with their bodies, have analyzed with their wisdom questions of this profound nature and have given answers, so it is.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ni tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gis spyi bo la thod bzhin du thogs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che ni tshangs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag gis spyi bo la thod bzhin du thogs te /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, the learned ones who practice pure conduct carry him on their heads like a crown.

original: blta ba'i phyir 'gros rnyed pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba de dag ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: blta ba'i phyir 'gros rnyed pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba de dag ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa'o //
translated: Those who seek to see him and serve him have gained a good gain.

original: bdag cag kyang rnyed pa legs par rnyed de /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang rnyed pa legs par rnyed de /
translated: We too have gained a good gain.

original: bdag cag tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che bdag cag sum cu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa la bdag mngon par spro zhing bstod la rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: bdag cag tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che bdag cag sum cu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa la bdag mngon par spro zhing bstod la rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: “We are not going just to see the Venerable Pūrṇa and to receive offerings. We are also going because we are delighted, praise, and rejoice in the Venerable Pūrṇa’s teaching of the thirty topics.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dge slong na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i chos ston par byed na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dge slong na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i chos ston par byed na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the Venerable Pūrṇa teaches the Dharma of disgust, detachment, and cessation to sick and dying monks, he is said to be a monk who speaks the Dharma.

original: skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: He is disgusted with and detached from birth, existence, grasping, craving, feeling, contact, the six sense sources, name and form, and consciousness, and he teaches the Dharma of their cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i chos ston par byed na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ston par byed na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he teaches the Dharma of cessation, he should be called a monk who speaks Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gag pa rtogs na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gag pa rtogs na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, if one is disgusted with, detached from, and ceases sickness and death, and realizes their cessation, he should be called a monk who speaks Dharma.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dag rtogs par gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dag rtogs par gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Up to: if one is disgusted with, detached from, and ceases consciousness, and realizes its cessation, he should be called a monk who speaks Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dge slong na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dang nye bar len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dge slong na ba dang 'chi ba la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa dang nye bar len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, if a monk is disgusted with, detached from, and ceases sickness and death, and his mind is liberated from defilements without grasping, he should be called a monk who speaks Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug dang / ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa la yid 'byung ba dang /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, when one is disgusted with birth, existence, grasping, craving, feeling, contact, the six sense sources, name and form, and consciousness,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur na dge slong chos kyi gtam smra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and when one’s mind is liberated from the defilements without attachment, having ceased grasping, one should be called a bhikṣu who speaks the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ston pa'i nyan thos @71a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu ston pa'i nyan thos @71a * //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, a learned and wise disciple of the Teacher,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bsam gtan dag la ni zhes bya ba la /

original: 'du shes ni 'bras so zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab kyi 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs te /

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān addressed the bhikṣus:

analyzed: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa 'dis shes par gyur na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, if one knows through this consciousness that Pūraṇa Kāśyapa is a boil and the root of a boil,

original: 'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa /
translated: this is the knowledge of all.

analyzed: 'di ni thams cad tshor ba'i shes pa'o zhes 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of the consciousness of all feelings.
