analyzed: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni thams cad ma rig pa la thams cad @72a * // rig pa'i nga rgyal can /
translated: Bhikṣus, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa is one who has the pride of knowing all, though he does not know all.🔽He has the pride of feeling all, though he does not feel all.

original: thams cad ma tshor ba la thams cad tshor ba'i nga rgyal can 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su ma bsal ba la 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'i nga rgyal can te /
analyzed: thams cad ma tshor ba la thams cad tshor ba'i nga rgyal can 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su ma bsal ba la 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'i nga rgyal can te /
translated: He has the pride of having eliminated the husk of the grain of the fruit, though he has not eliminated the husk of the grain of the fruit.

original: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, Pūraṇa Kāśyapa has such views and speaks in such a way.

original: 'du shes ni nad do //🔽'du shes ni 'bras so //
analyzed: 'du shes ni nad do // 'du shes ni 'bras so //
translated: He says, ‘Sensation is a disease.🔽Sensation is a boil.

original: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
translated: Sensation is a thorn.

original: 'du shes med pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The absence of sensation is complete delusion.

original: 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shas med min skye mched ni zhib /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shas med min skye mched ni zhib /
translated: The base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is peace.

original: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lam bsgoms nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ni gya nom pa'o zhes de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lam bsgoms nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes so //
translated: He thought, ‘This is excellent,’ and by cultivating the path of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, he was reborn with a fortune equal to that of the gods of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba can /
analyzed: dge slong dag rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba can /
translated: “Monks, the son of Rāma, Aṭṭhaka, was one who held the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas bcings shing yongs su ma grol ba /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas bcings shing yongs su ma grol ba /
translated: He was bound by the view of the transitory collection and was not liberated.

original: 'jig tshogs can te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs can te /
translated: He was one who had the transitory collection.

original: de gnas de nas 'chi 'phos nas 'di lta bu 'ong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnas de nas 'chi 'phos nas 'di lta bu 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he died and transmigrated from that place, he came to be like this.

original: skye gnas dman pa byi la'i skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye gnas dman pa byi la'i skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He was reborn in a lowly womb, in the womb of a cat.

original: dge slong dag gang zhig 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa 'dis yongs su shes par gyur na /🔽'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zhig 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa 'dis yongs su shes par gyur na / 'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa /
translated: “Monks, if one understands through this consciousness, ‘This is the husk of the rice,’🔽this is the knowledge of all.

original: 'di ni thams cad tshor ba'i shes pa'o zhes smra ba 'di ni yang dag par smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad tshor ba'i shes pa'o zhes smra ba 'di ni yang dag par smra ba ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of all feeling.’ This is what is said correctly.

original: ci'i phyir de'i yang dag par smras pas smra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i yang dag par smras pas smra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is he called one who speaks correctly?

original: 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa 'dis shes par gyur na 'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa 'di ni thams cad tshor ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal ba'o zhes rnam par shes pa 'dis shes par gyur na 'di ni thams cad rig pa'i shes pa 'di ni thams cad tshor ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: When he understands through this consciousness, “The fruit and the root of the fruit have been eliminated,” this is the knowledge of one who knows everything. This is the knowledge of one who feels everything.

original: dge slong dag ji ltar thams cad rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar thams cad rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Monks, how does one know everything?

original: 'di ni dge slong rig pa'i skye mched drug rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong rig pa'i skye mched drug rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of the monk who knows as it truly is the origin, disappearance, enjoyment, danger, and escape of the six sense bases.

original: 'di ltar na dge slong thams cad rig bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na dge slong thams cad rig bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, monks, one knows everything.

original: dge slong ji ltar na dge slong thams cad tshor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong ji ltar na dge slong thams cad tshor ba yin zhe na /
translated: Monks, how does a monk feel everything?

original: 'di na dge slong tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang / mi snang ba dang / ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: Here, monks, a monk knows the origin, disappearance, satisfaction, drawback, and escape of feelings,

original: 'di ltar na dge slong thams cad tshor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar na dge slong thams cad tshor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and thus he is called a monk who has attained all feelings.

original: dge slong dag 'bras zhes bya ba 'di ni @72b lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhis bskyed cing pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba las yang dag par byung ba zan dron dang 'bras chan gyis gsos shing /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'bras zhes bya ba 'di ni @72b lus gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhis bskyed cing pha dang ma'i mi gtsang ba las yang dag par byung ba zan dron dang 'bras chan gyis gsos shing /
translated: “Monks, ‘grain’ is a designation for the gross physical body, which is produced by the four great elements and originates from the father and mother, and is nourished by various kinds of food and drink.

original: rtag tu khrus dang byug pa byas kyang 'jig cing gyes pa'i chos can gyi de'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: rtag tu khrus dang byug pa byas kyang 'jig cing gyes pa'i chos can gyi de'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: It is subject to impermanence, destruction, disintegration, and dissolution, and is a basis for the designation of ‘grain.’

original: dge slong dag 'bras kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba 'di ni mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i gzugs la 'dzag cing /🔽rna ba ni sgra /🔽sna ni dri /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'bras kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba 'di ni mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i gzugs la 'dzag cing / rna ba ni sgra / sna ni dri /
translated: “Monks, ‘the root of grain’ is a designation for the eye, which is attracted to and delights in forms that are agreeable and attractive.

original: lce ni ro //
analyzed: lce ni ro //
translated: The ear is attracted to and delights in sounds.🔽The nose is attracted to and delights in smells.🔽The tongue is attracted to and delights in tastes.

original: lus ni reg bya dang / yid ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i chos la 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni reg bya dang / yid ni yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i chos la 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the tactile object, and the mind is the object of the mind, which is either pleasant or unpleasant.

original: 'bras kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba 'di ni ma rig pa dang srid pa'i sred pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: 'bras kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba 'di ni ma rig pa dang srid pa'i sred pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: The root of the rice refers to ignorance and craving for existence.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong ma rig pa dang srid pa'i srid pa yongs su spangs shing yongs su shes par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong ma rig pa dang srid pa'i srid pa yongs su spangs shing yongs su shes par gyur pa ste /
translated: The monk who has abandoned and fully understood ignorance and craving for existence🔽is like a palm tree whose crown has been cut off, uprooted, incapable of growing again. This is called the full understanding of the root of the rice and the rice.

original: shing ta la mgo bcad pa ltar drungs phyung zhing mi snang zhing phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du byas pa 'di ni 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal bar yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shing ta la mgo bcad pa ltar drungs phyung zhing mi snang zhing phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du byas pa 'di ni 'bras dang 'bras kyi rtsa ba yongs su bsal bar yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra says:

original: gang sems gnas pa dang yang dag mar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /🔽de dang de las 'don te /
analyzed: gang sems gnas pa dang yang dag mar gnas pa zhes bya ba la /🔽de dang de las 'don te /
translated: What is the mind that is settled and well settled?🔽It is the mind that is free from the five hindrances,

original: ji ltar re zhig lam gyi tshoms kyi lam gyi yan lag gi sgo'i log pa nyid ces bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa'i mdo gsum pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas bzhi par /
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig lam gyi tshoms kyi lam gyi yan lag gi sgo'i log pa nyid ces bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun pa'i mdo gsum pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas bzhi par /
translated: The fourth chapter of the Abhidharmakośa states:🔽The three stainless form is said to increase,

original: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam rdzogs phyir //
analyzed: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam rdzogs phyir //
translated: because it is not created and the path is completed.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs su /
translated: This is the context of the verse.

original: spong ba dag ni chu lon du gsungs zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba dag ni chu lon du gsungs zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The verse should be viewed as “cessation is said to be a dike.”

original: 'o na mdo las bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /🔽lam gyi tshoms gyi dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mtha'i cha las 'byung ba blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la / lam gyi tshoms gyi dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mtha'i cha las 'byung ba blta bar bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then the sūtras state, “What is the faculty of pleasure?

original: 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /
translated: This should be viewed as the final part of the second verse of the chapter on the faculties in the chapter on the path of the Collection of Aphorisms.🔽This is explained in the second chapter of the Abhidharmakośa:

original: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: Whatever unpleasant physical feeling there is

original: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
translated: is explained to be the faculty of pain.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba la bsam gtan gyi rnam par byed pa de dang de las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong ba zhes bya ba la bsam gtan gyi rnam par byed pa de dang de las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: The fourth absorption is described in the sūtras:

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral te /🔽dran pa shes rab dang ldan zhing btang snyoms su gnas te /🔽bde ba lus kyis myong ba gang 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan zhing btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral te / dran pa shes rab dang ldan zhing btang snyoms su gnas te / bde ba lus kyis myong ba gang 'phags pa rnams kyis dran pa dang ldan zhing btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The fourth absorption is when a monk, having abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain, and also having previously abandoned joy and sorrow, achieves and remains in the fourth absorption which is beyond pleasure and pain, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.🔽The third absorption is described in the sūtras:

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The third absorption is when a monk, having abandoned pleasure, having abandoned pain, having previously abandoned joy and sorrow, achieves and remains in the fourth absorption which is beyond pleasure and pain, and is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: gang gi tshe @73a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe @73a * //
translated: The second absorption is described in the sūtras:🔽The second absorption is when a monk, having abandoned discursive thoughts and analyzed discursive thoughts, internally achieves and remains in a mind of unified focus and concentration, and also achieves and remains in the joy and bliss born of concentration.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The first absorption is described in the sūtras:🔽The first absorption is when a monk, having abandoned desires and also having abandoned sinful and nonvirtuous qualities, achieves and remains in the first absorption which is accompanied by thought and analysis, and is born of seclusion and joy and bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra bar dbyar gnas pa'i phyir gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra bar dbyar gnas pa'i phyir gshegs so //
translated: The four formless states are described in the sūtras:🔽The fourth formless state is when a monk, having completely transcended the sphere of nothing whatsoever, achieves and remains in the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception.🔽The third formless state is when a monk, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: The second formless state is when a monk, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space, achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan par mdzad /🔽yang dag par bskul /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan par mdzad / yang dag par bskul /
translated: While sitting to one side, the Blessed One taught the householder Anāthapiṇḍada through discussion of the Dharma.🔽He exhorted him.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He encouraged him.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad de /
translated: He delighted him.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis rnam grangs du mar yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par bskul /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis rnam grangs du mar yang dag par bstan / yang dag par bskul /
translated: Through discussion of the Dharma, he taught him in many ways.🔽He exhorted him.🔽He encouraged him.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He delighted him.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung par bzhugs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung par bzhugs so //
translated: Then, having taught him in many ways through discussion of the Dharma, having exhorted him, having encouraged him, and having delighted him, he remained silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar te phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar te phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, made the gesture of supplication to the Blessed One, and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, I request that the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, accept my invitation to spend the rainy season in Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu zla ba gsum du chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad bzhes par gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu zla ba gsum du chos gos dang bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad bzhes par gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: May the Blessed One consent to spend the three months of the rains with his community of monks in my house, accepting my robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick, all that is required for living.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la cad mi gsung bar gnang bar mdzad do /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la cad mi gsung bar gnang bar mdzad do /
translated: The Blessed One assented to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada by remaining silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bar gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bar gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas song ngo //
translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, understanding that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and departed.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu dbyar zla ba gsum du khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yod byad kyis nye bar gnas par byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu dbyar zla ba gsum du khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yod byad kyis nye bar gnas par byas te /
translated: The Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of monks, spent the three months of the rainy season at the home of the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, who provided them with Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for the sick, and other necessities.

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin dbyar zla ba gsum 'das pa'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin dbyar zla ba gsum 'das pa'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: After the three months of the rainy season had passed, the householder Anāthapiṇḍada went to see the Blessed One and, bowing his head at the Blessed One’s feet, sat to one side.

original: phyogs @73b gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: phyogs @73b gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: As he sat to one side, the Blessed One said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada:

original: khyim bdag legs so legs so de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu dbyar zla ba gsum du chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis nye bar gnas par byas kyi /
analyzed: khyim bdag legs so legs so de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu dbyar zla ba gsum du chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i rkyen sman dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyis nye bar gnas par byas kyi /
translated: “Householder, excellent, excellent! You have provided the Thus-Gone One and the saṅgha of monks with Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for the sick, and other provisions for living for three months of the rainy season.

original: khyim bdag ma 'ongs pa na mtho ris 'grub par byed pa skal pa khyad par can gyi rnam par smin pa bde ba can gong mar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag ma 'ongs pa na mtho ris 'grub par byed pa skal pa khyad par can gyi rnam par smin pa bde ba can gong mar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Householder, in the future you will attain the higher realms, which are the ripening of your special merit that brings about the attainment of the higher realms.

original: khyim bdag 'di tsam kyis dga' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag 'di tsam kyis dga' bar mi bya ste /
translated: “Householder, do not be satisfied with just this much.

original: 'on kyang dus dang dus su rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dus dang dus su rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te /
translated: Instead, from time to time you should actualize and accomplish the happiness of solitude with your body.

original: gnas pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: You should train in that way.”

original: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo ;
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo ;
translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada rejoiced in and praised the words of the Blessed One and departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: / de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dus pa de na tshogs shing 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: / de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dus pa de na tshogs shing 'dug par gyur te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra was in the assembly and was seated among the gathered assembly.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song nas ring du lon par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song nas ring du lon par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, knowing that a long time had passed since the householder Anāthapiṇḍada had departed from the presence of the Blessed One, said to the Blessed One,🔽“Lord, it is amazing, it is astonishing,

original: btsun pa ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba nas 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin las brtsams te /
analyzed: btsun pa ngo mtshar ro zhes bya ba nas 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin las brtsams te /
translated: that the Blessed One, beginning with the householder Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: khyim bdag legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: has said, ‘Householder, it is excellent, it is excellent,’🔽and so on up to ‘one should train in that.’

original: snga ma bzhin du de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Train in this as before.🔽

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i tshe chos lnga yongs su spong zhing chos lnga bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i bde ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i tshe chos lnga yongs su spong zhing chos lnga bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When noble disciples actualize and accomplish the bliss of solitude with their bodies, at that time they abandon five things and complete the cultivation of five things.

original: chos lnga yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos lnga yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five things that they abandon?

original: gang yang 'dod pa nye bar sdud pa'i yid bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang 'dod pa nye bar sdud pa'i yid mi bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang yang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i yid bde ba yongs su spong ba dang /
analyzed: gang yang 'dod pa nye bar sdud pa'i yid bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang 'dod pa nye bar sdud pa'i yid mi bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang yang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i yid bde ba yongs su spong ba dang /
translated: They abandon mental satisfaction that is associated with desire, they abandon mental dissatisfaction that is associated with desire, they abandon mental satisfaction that is associated with nonvirtue,

original: gang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i yid mi bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i btang snyoms yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba ste /🔽chos lnga po 'di dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i yid mi bde ba yongs su spong ba dang / gang mi dge ba nye bar sdud pa'i btang snyoms yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba ste / chos lnga po 'di dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they abandon mental dissatisfaction that is associated with nonvirtue, and they abandon equanimity that is associated with nonvirtue.🔽They abandon these five things.

original: chos lnga po @74a * //
analyzed: chos lnga po @74a * //
translated: What are the five things that they complete?

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete perfection of meditation?

original: dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / rangs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: It is joy, delight, pliancy, happiness, and concentration.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: Śāriputra, it is just so.

original: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing bsgrubs te gnas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing bsgrubs te gnas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When the noble disciple actualizes and accomplishes physical seclusion and abides in it,

original: snga ma bzhin du ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: up to concentration is just as before.

original: mdo las kyang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las kyang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, a sūtra says, “Physical pliancy.”

original: lam gyi tshoms kyi byang chub kyi yan lag gi sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo dang po las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /
analyzed: lam gyi tshoms kyi byang chub kyi yan lag gi sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo dang po las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /
translated: In the first chapter of the second section of the Treasury of Abhidharma,

original: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: dad dang bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
translated: it says, “Faith, heedfulness, and pliancy.”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang / mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes bya bar bris pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang / mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes bya bar bris pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the verse summary, and the sutra does not say “pliancy of the body,” right?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are contaminated phenomena?

original: skye mched drug gi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i sdom dang po'i lam zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i tha ma las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i sdom dang po'i lam zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i tha ma las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
translated: The first summary verse of the collection on the six bases states:

original: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //
analyzed: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //
translated: Contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena.

original: zhes bya bar bris zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bris zin to //
translated: This is written in the first chapter of the Abhidharmakośa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the Sūtra on Transformation:

original: lam gyi tshogs kyi dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs kyi dbang po'i sgo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las 'byung ba mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
translated: The second summary verse of the collection on the path states:

original: nang gi skyon dang chos mtshungs phyir //
analyzed: nang gi skyon dang chos mtshungs phyir //
translated: Because they are similar to internal faults.

original: zhes bya bar bstan cing /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bstan cing /
translated: This is taught in the third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal gyis dbang po 'gags so zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal gyis dbang po 'gags so zhes bya bar bshad zin to //
translated: Here it is explained that the faculty of pain is stopped by suffering.🔽The Transformation of the Basis Sūtra declares:

original: rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las bsam gtan bzhi pa na bde ba'i dbang po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par sgyur ba'i mdo las bsam gtan bzhi pa na bde ba'i dbang po 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In the fourth absorption, the faculty of pleasure ceases.

original: bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abandoning pleasure,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas mdo de dang de las 'don pa ste /🔽de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas mdo de dang de las 'don pa ste / de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: in that and that sūtra, taking the fourth absorption as the basis, it is recited.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par btang snyoms yongs su dag par bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes 'byung /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin par btang snyoms yongs su dag par bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes 'byung /
translated: Having abandoned pleasure, having abandoned pain, previously having removed mental pleasure and displeasure, he dwells having attained the fourth absorption that is neither painful nor pleasurable and possesses complete purity of mindfulness through equanimity.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang bcas par gsungs zhes bya ba lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs @74b su bcad pa gnyis pa'i dang po'i mdo las te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir g-yo ba dang bcas par gsungs zhes bya ba lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs @74b su bcad pa gnyis pa'i dang po'i mdo las te /
translated: The Bhagavan said that the first three absorptions possess fluctuation because they possess faults.🔽This is the first line of the second verse of the summary of the medium length discourses.

original: mdo dum bu mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
analyzed: mdo dum bu mdzod kyi gnas gsum par /
translated: The third part of the Treasury of Abhidharma says:

original: bzhi pa g-yo ba med pa yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa g-yo ba med pa yin //
translated: The fourth is without fluctuation.

original: zhes bya bar bshad pa blta bar bya'o //🔽mdo las rlung med pa'i mar me dper mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bshad pa blta bar bya'o // mdo las rlung med pa'i mar me dper mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: This should be examined.🔽Because the sutras use the example of a butter lamp free of wind.

original: phung po las /
analyzed: phung po las /
translated: The Āgama sutras say:

original: dbyu gu gsum dang gong bu gsum //
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum dang gong bu gsum //
translated: Three sticks and three balls

original: lu hi ta yi rnam bshad gnyis //
analyzed: lu hi ta yi rnam bshad gnyis //
translated: And two explanations of lūhita

original: zhes bya ba'i lu hi ta'i mdo dang po la rlung med pa'i mar me'i dpe 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lu hi ta'i mdo dang po la rlung med pa'i mar me'i dpe 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: In the first lūhita sutra, this example of a butter lamp free of wind is recited:

original: lu hi ta gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba yang spangs shing /
analyzed: lu hi ta gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba yang spangs shing /
translated: When the noble disciple abandons pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: abandons pain,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i tshe sems mtho bar mi 'gyur zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo ba thob ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i tshe sems mtho bar mi 'gyur zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo ba thob ste /
translated: When he has accomplished and dwells in the fourth meditation, his mind does not become high or low, but remains steady and unshaken.

original: dper na khang pa'am khang pa'i khyams su mar me bzhag pa dud 'gro'am bya'am mis ma bskul zhing ma bskyod pa de srid du mi mtho mi dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo ba thob po //
analyzed: dper na khang pa'am khang pa'i khyams su mar me bzhag pa dud 'gro'am bya'am mis ma bskul zhing ma bskyod pa de srid du mi mtho mi dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo ba thob po //
translated: For example, a lamp placed in a house or on a terrace, not shaken by wind, does not become high or low, but remains steady and unshaken.

original: lu hi ta gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos bsam gtan can bde ba yang spangs shing zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i sems kyang de'i tshe mtho bar mi 'gyur zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo🔽ba thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lu hi ta gang gi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos bsam gtan can bde ba yang spangs shing zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa de'i sems kyang de'i tshe mtho bar mi 'gyur zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur bar mngon par gnas shing mi g-yo ba thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the noble disciple, the meditator, has given up pleasure, and so on up to: when he has accomplished and dwells in the fourth meditation, his mind does not become high or low, but remains steady and unshaken.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad mdor bsdus te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin thams cad mdor bsdus te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, all concentrations are summarized in the following verse:

original: gleng gzhi ni ma nyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni ma nyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The Buddha spoke this verse in Shravasti.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Concentration is threefold:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa cam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa cam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes gsungs so //
translated: concentration with applied thought and sustained thought, concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought, and concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la /🔽gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //🔽ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la / gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o // ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there is the concentration of emptiness,🔽the concentration of signlessness, and the concentration of wishlessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes gsungs so //
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the concentration that takes emptiness as its object.🔽The concentration of signlessness is the concentration that takes the wishless as its object.🔽The concentration of wishlessness is the concentration that takes cessation as its object.

original: lam yang gzings lta bur gdon mi za bar dor bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam yang gzings lta bur gdon mi za bar dor bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path is like a raft, for it is to be left behind without fail.

original: 'di lta ste chu bo gangg'a chus yongs su gang zhing rgyas te bya rog btung du rung ba tsam du gyur la gru 'am gzings med par rgyun phyogs dang bzlog phyogs dang pha rol dang tshu rol gyi 'gram du brgal bar mi nus pas /🔽gang bdag gis rtsa @75a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chu bo gangg'a chus yongs su gang zhing rgyas te bya rog btung du rung ba tsam du gyur la gru 'am gzings med par rgyun phyogs dang bzlog phyogs dang pha rol dang tshu rol gyi 'gram du brgal bar mi nus pas / gang bdag gis rtsa @75a * //
translated: It is like this: the Ganges River is completely full of water, so that even a crow could drink from it, but there is no boat or raft, and one is unable to cross to the other side or this side of the river, either with the current or against it.🔽“I will gather together many roots,

original: dang ; shing dang / 'dab ma dang / lo ma mang po dag bsdus te /
analyzed: dang ; shing dang / 'dab ma dang / lo ma mang po dag bsdus te /
translated: wood, leaves, and branches,

original: gzings byas pa /
analyzed: gzings byas pa /
translated: and make a raft.🔽Relying on the raft, staying on the raft,🔽I will use my two hands to make an effort and go to the other side.”

original: gzings la brten cing gzings la gnas te lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol pas pha rol du 'gro bar bya'o zhes de de ltar rnam par dpyad nas rtsva dang / shing dang / 'dab ma dang / lo ma mang po dag bsdus te gzings byas nas /
analyzed: gzings la brten cing gzings la gnas te lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol pas pha rol du 'gro bar bya'o zhes de de ltar rnam par dpyad nas rtsva dang / shing dang / 'dab ma dang / lo ma mang po dag bsdus te gzings byas nas /
translated: Having analyzed it in this way, he gathers together many roots, wood, leaves, and branches, and makes a raft.

original: gzings la brten cing gzings la gnas te /
analyzed: gzings la brten cing gzings la gnas te /
translated: Relying on the raft, staying on the raft,

original: rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol tu phyin te /
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol tu phyin te /
translated: he uses his two hands to make an effort against the current and safely reaches the other side.

original: de nas skyes bu de 'di snyam du gzings 'di ni bdag la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu de 'di snyam du gzings 'di ni bdag la phan pa mang po byed pa ste /
translated: Then that person would think, “This raft has been of great benefit to me.

original: bdag gzings 'di la brten cing gzings la gnas nas rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol tu brgal te /
analyzed: bdag gzings 'di la brten cing gzings la gnas nas rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol tu brgal te /
translated: Relying on this raft and staying on it, I have used my two hands to exert myself and have safely crossed to the other side.

original: gang bdag gis gzings 'di ni mgo bo'am phrag pa la khur te gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar bya'o zhes /
analyzed: gang bdag gis gzings 'di ni mgo bo'am phrag pa la khur te gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar bya'o zhes /
translated: I will carry this raft on my head or shoulders and go wherever I want.”

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽skyes bu des phan pa mang po byed ba skyes bu de de lta de ltar rtog bzhin du gzings de mgo bo 'am phrag pa la khur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems / skyes bu des phan pa mang po byed ba skyes bu de de lta de ltar rtog bzhin du gzings de mgo bo 'am phrag pa la khur te /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: gang du 'dod pa der 'gro'am /
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa der 'gro'am /
translated: Would that person, who has been of such great benefit, carry that raft on his head or shoulders and go wherever he wants?🔽”

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Reverend.”

original: de nas skyes bu de 'di snyam du gzings 'dis cung zad phan pa mang po byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas skyes bu de 'di snyam du gzings 'dis cung zad phan pa mang po byed pa yin te /
translated: Then that person would think, “This raft has been of great benefit to me.

original: bdag gzings 'di la brten cing gzings la gnas te rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol gyi ngos su brgal bar byas kyang bdag gis gzings 'di thang las bskyur ba 'am chu'i rgyun la bskyur bar bya'o zhes des gzings de
analyzed: bdag gzings 'di la brten cing gzings la gnas te rgyun las bzlog phyogs su lag pa gnyis kyis rtsol bas bde bar pha rol gyi ngos su brgal bar byas kyang bdag gis gzings 'di thang las bskyur ba 'am chu'i rgyun la bskyur bar bya'o zhes des gzings de
translated: I will rely on this boat and stay on it. With my two hands I will work against the current and safely cross to the other side. But I will throw this boat up on dry land or into the water.’

original: thang la bskyur ba 'am chu'i rgyun du bskyur te ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro na /
analyzed: thang la bskyur ba 'am chu'i rgyun du bskyur te ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro na /
translated: He throws the boat up on dry land or into the water and goes wherever he wants.

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: skyes bu de gzings de la de lta de ltar rtog pa na bya ba byas pa yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bu de gzings de la de lta de ltar rtog pa na bya ba byas pa yin nam /
translated: Has that man done what he had to do with that boat?”

original: btsun pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa de bzhin no //
translated: “Yes, Lord.”

original: dge slong dag de bzhin du ngas bstan pa'i chos rnams kyang nges par 'byung ba'i phyir yin gyi //
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin du ngas bstan pa'i chos rnams kyang nges par 'byung ba'i phyir yin gyi //
translated: “Monks, in the same way, I have taught the Dharma for the sake of renunciation,

original: yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not for the sake of grasping.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na ngas gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa dag shes nas sngar chos ma yin pa bzhin du chos kyang spang bar bya'o zhes lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bkra shis pa'i mdo las 'byung ngo
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na ngas gzings lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan pa dag shes nas sngar chos ma yin pa bzhin du chos kyang spang bar bya'o zhes lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bkra shis pa'i mdo las 'byung ngo
translated: The second verse of the Summary of the Middle Way, which is found in the Auspicious Sutra, says:

original: // dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three doors of liberation are stainless.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa @75b na'o ;
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa @75b na'o ;
translated: The setting is Śrāvastī.

original: / rnam par thar pa'i sgo ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / rnam par thar pa'i sgo ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three doors of liberation.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The door of liberation of emptiness, the door of liberation of signlessness, and the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are also three concentrations.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is Śrāvastī.

original: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
translated: There are also three concentrations.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / smon pa med pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the meditative stabilization of the wishlessness of wishlessness.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, there are four kinds of cultivation of meditative stabilization.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is Śrāvastī.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of cultivation of meditative stabilization.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: What are the four?🔽There is cultivation of meditative stabilization that, when cultivated, developed, and made much of, leads to abiding in comfort in this very life.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes par 'gyur ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes par 'gyur ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There is cultivation of meditative stabilization that, when cultivated, developed, and made much of, leads to knowledge and insight.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes rab rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes rab rab tu 'byed par 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There is the cultivation of samādhi that, when practiced, cultivated, and made much of, leads to the discernment of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na zag pa zad par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na zag pa zad par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There is the cultivation of samādhi that, when practiced, cultivated, and made much of, leads to the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bstan goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bstan goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the cultivation of samādhi that, when practiced, cultivated, and made much of, leads to abiding in ease in this very life?

original: 'di na dge slong lus 'di rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas mngon par gang zhing rgyas la khyab ste /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong lus 'di rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas mngon par gang zhing rgyas la khyab ste /
translated: Here a monk is filled, saturated, and suffused with the joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: 'di lta ste rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba lus 'di la ma khyab pa'i cha cung zad kyang med par khyab par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba lus 'di la ma khyab pa'i cha cung zad kyang med par khyab par gnas pa ste /
translated: There is not a single part of his body that is not suffused with the joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: dper na khrus mkhan nam khrus mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pas 'dag chal gyi phye ma zhib mo dag zangs gzhong ngam 'khar gzhong ngam nya phyis kyi nang du chu dang bcug nas spangs na gong du de rlan pa dang rlan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: dper na khrus mkhan nam khrus mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pas 'dag chal gyi phye ma zhib mo dag zangs gzhong ngam 'khar gzhong ngam nya phyis kyi nang du chu dang bcug nas spangs na gong du de rlan pa dang rlan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang /
translated: For example, a skilled bath attendant or bath attendant’s apprentice would put fine bath powder in a copper bowl or wooden bowl or conch shell bowl, mix it with water, and knead it until it becomes moist and the moisture permeates inside and out, so that it is soft and does not scatter.

original: phyi dang nang dag rlan pas khyab cing sla ba dang 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na dge slong lus 'di zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang dag rlan pas khyab cing sla ba dang 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na dge slong lus 'di zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, a monk, with regard to this body, as before…

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o//
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o//
translated: This is said to be the cultivation of samādhi that, when practiced, developed, and made much of, leads to being at ease in the present life.

original: @76a * // ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes par 'gyur ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: @76a * // ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa yongs su bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na shes par 'gyur ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the cultivation of samādhi that leads to knowledge and insight?

original: 'di na dge slong snang ba'i 'du shes legs par rab tu bzung zhing legs par yid la byas legs par mngon sum du byed cing bsgom pa ste nyin mo ji lta bar mtshan mo de bzhin /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong snang ba'i 'du shes legs par rab tu bzung zhing legs par yid la byas legs par mngon sum du byed cing bsgom pa ste nyin mo ji lta bar mtshan mo de bzhin /
translated: Here, a monk properly holds, properly attends, properly manifests, and properly cultivates the perception of light.

original: mtshan mo ji lta bar nyin mo de bzhin /🔽snga ma ji lta bar phyis de bzhin /
analyzed: mtshan mo ji lta bar nyin mo de bzhin / snga ma ji lta bar phyis de bzhin /
translated: Just as during the day, so also at night.🔽Just as in the past, so also in the future.

original: phyis ji lta bar sngar de bzhin /
analyzed: phyis ji lta bar sngar de bzhin /
translated: Just as in the future, so also in the present.🔽Just as above, so also below.

analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi rnam par bshad pa nye bar mkho ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter of the Abhidharmakosabhhasya-vrtti-pada-vyakhya called “The Necessary One.🔽”

original: gnas brgyad pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gnas brgyad pa phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The eighth chapter is almost entirely devoted to the sutras.

original: // / de ltar mod kyi ci bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / de ltar mod kyi ci bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha said that form is not the self.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Shravasti.

original: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag bdag ma yin na da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag bdag ma yin na da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Monks, if past and future forms are not the self, what need is there to speak of present forms?

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar mthong ba'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su 'gyur zhing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' la da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar mthong ba'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su 'gyur zhing ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' la da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, in this way, the noble disciple who has seen the truth, who is learned, becomes indifferent to past forms, does not delight in future forms, and becomes disgusted and detached from present forms.

original: dge slong dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag bdag ma yin na da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te ;
analyzed: dge slong dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag bdag ma yin na da ltar byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te ;
translated: Monks, if past and future feelings, discriminations, composites, and consciousnesses are not the self, what need is there to speak of present feelings, discriminations, composites, and consciousnesses?

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar mthong ba'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar mthong ba'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la btang snyoms su 'gyur zhing /
translated: Monks, in this way, the noble disciple who has seen the truth, who is learned, becomes indifferent to past forms,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par mi dga' la /
translated: does not delight in future forms,🔽and becomes disgusted and detached from present forms.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //🔽gnyis @78a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so // gnyis @78a * //
translated: and one becomes disgusted with and freed from attachment to present form.

original: la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is the statement: “Consciousness arises in dependence on two,🔽that is, in dependence on the six bases.”

original: skye mched drug gi tshogs las 'don te /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi tshogs las 'don te /
translated: This is extracted from the six bases.

original: de yang mdzod kyi gnas lnga par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsam par bya'o zhes bya bar rnam par bshad pa bstan la /
analyzed: de yang mdzod kyi gnas lnga par 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa bsam par bya'o zhes bya bar rnam par bshad pa bstan la /
translated: This is explained in the fifth chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, which states: “Past and future should be considered.”

original: mdzod kyi gnas gsum par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs su reg pa'i yan lag rnam par dbye ba bris par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas gsum par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs su reg pa'i yan lag rnam par dbye ba bris par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, in the section on dependent origination, explains the analysis of the factor of contact.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag mig gi rgyu dang gzugs kyi rkyen la brten te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag mig gi rgyu dang gzugs kyi rkyen la brten te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, the statement: “Monks, in dependence on the cause of the eye and the condition of form,”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: is the nidāna.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then another monk went to the Bhagavān.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: and then sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, that monk said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye /
analyzed: btsun pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye /
translated: “Venerable, what is the cause and what is the condition for the arising of eye-consciousness?

original: btsun pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, what is the cause and what is the condition for the arising of ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-consciousness?”

original: dge slong mig gi rgyu dang gzugs kyi rkyen la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong mig gi rgyu dang gzugs kyi rkyen la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Monk, in dependence on the eye as cause and forms as condition, eye-consciousness arises.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni mig dang gzugs la brten te byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni mig dang gzugs la brten te byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever eye-consciousness there is, all of it arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: rna ba'i rgyu dang sgra'i rkyen la brten nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rna ba'i rgyu dang sgra'i rkyen la brten nas rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on the ear as cause and sounds as condition, ear-consciousness arises.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni rna ba dang sgra la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni rna ba dang sgra la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever ear consciousness there is, all of it arises in dependence on the ear and sounds.

original: dge slong dag sna'i rgyu dang dri'i rkyen la brten nas sna'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sna'i rgyu dang dri'i rkyen la brten nas sna'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, nose consciousness arises in dependence on the nose and smells as causal conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sna dang dri la brten nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni sna dang dri la brten nas byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever nose consciousness there is, all of it arises in dependence on the nose and smells.

original: lce'i rgyu dang ro'i rkyen la brten nas lce'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lce'i rgyu dang ro'i rkyen la brten nas lce'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, tongue consciousness arises in dependence on the tongue and tastes as causal conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni lce dang ro la brten nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni lce dang ro la brten nas byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever tongue consciousness there is, all of it arises in dependence on the tongue and tastes.

original: lus kyi rgyu dang reg bya'i rkyen la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu dang reg bya'i rkyen la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Monks, body consciousness arises in dependence on the body and touchable things as causal conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni lus dang reg bya la brten nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ba de thams cad ni lus dang reg bya la brten nas byung ba'o //
translated: Whatever the body consciousness, it all arises in dependence on the body and tactile objects.

original: yid kyi rgyu dang chos kyi rkyen la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi rgyu dang chos kyi rkyen la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In dependence on the mental faculty and the condition of a dharma, the mental consciousness arises.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang @78b rung ba de thams cad ni yid dang chos la brten nas byung ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang ci yang @78b rung ba de thams cad ni yid dang chos la brten nas byung ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever the mental consciousness, it all arises in dependence on the mental faculty and a dharma.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de yang phung po las 'don te /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de yang phung po las 'don te /
translated: That which is called consciousness that arises in dependence on causes and conditions is also included in the aggregates.

analyzed: 'das pa yis ni bzhi dag dang // skyo dang yongs su grol ba dang // rgyu yis rnam pa gnyis byed cing //
translated: The past has four, and also the discouraged and the liberated, and the cause has two aspects.

original: gnyis po gzhan ni ro myang bas //
analyzed: gnyis po gzhan ni ro myang bas //
translated: The other two are savoring.

original: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo bdun pa dang brgyad pa las 'byung ba 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i mdo bdun pa dang brgyad pa las 'byung ba 'di nyid kyi mdzod kyi gnas gnyis par /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag med // ces bya bar bris pa blta bar bya'o //
