analyzed: dris pa'i mtha' bsdu bar mi nus so //
translated: I cannot answer your questions.”

original: da'i drung du tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa rnams ni sdug bsngal yang dag par zad cing sdug bsngal mthar byas nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro zhing /
analyzed: da'i drung du tshangs par spyod pa bsten pa rnams ni sdug bsngal yang dag par zad cing sdug bsngal mthar byas nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro zhing /
translated: “Those who practice pure conduct in your presence will completely end suffering, put an end to suffering, and attain nirvāṇa.

original: mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the end, they will attain nirvāṇa.”

original: de nas ta la'i bram ze shing s'a la chen po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas ta la'i bram ze shing s'a la chen po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: Then the brahmin of the Tāla Grove rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words, and he took leave of the Blessed One.

original: srog chags drug pa lta bu'i mdo las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srog chags drug pa lta bu'i mdo las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutra that states “like the sixth being” is as follows.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, it is like this.

original: skyes bu mdze can lus nyams pa lus smin pa dbang po sdug bsngal gyis nye bar bcom pa dag smyig ma'i nags su zhugs na /
analyzed: skyes bu mdze can lus nyams pa lus smin pa dbang po sdug bsngal gyis nye bar bcom pa dag smyig ma'i nags su zhugs na /
translated: If a person with leprosy, whose body is impaired and rotting, whose faculties are overcome by suffering, enters a grove of reeds,

original: smyig ma'i lo ma dang tsher ma dag lus la zug cing /
analyzed: smyig ma'i lo ma dang tsher ma dag lus la zug cing /
translated: the leaves and thorns of the reeds will pierce his body.

original: rtsva dang shing dang rkang pa la zug cing /
analyzed: rtsva dang shing dang rkang pa la zug cing /
translated: The grass, trees, and ground will pierce his feet.

original: de'i rgyus sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyus sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, he will experience suffering.

original: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid so @79b sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid so @79b sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will experience intense, sharp, harsh, and unpleasant sensations.

original: de bzhin du 'di na kha cig reg pa'i skye mched drug gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di na kha cig reg pa'i skye mched drug gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, here some experience suffering through the six bases of contact.

original: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They experience intense, sharp, harsh, and unpleasant sensations.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched kyis sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched kyis sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The sense source of eye contact is experienced as suffering.

original: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One experiences the intense, burning, harsh, and unpleasant.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The sense sources of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact are experienced as suffering.

original: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drag pa tsha ba rtsub pa yid du mi 'ong ba nyid so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One experiences the intense, burning, harsh, and unpleasant.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this:

original: gdug pa can la shing ngam shing gi sdong po dag gis snad na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gdug pa can la shing ngam shing gi sdong po dag gis snad na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When a poisonous snake is injured by a tree or a tree trunk, it experiences suffering.

original: nad dang bcas pa dang / chu ser dang / rnag 'dzag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na skyes bu kha cig gtum zhing ngor smra ba'i rang bzhin can du gyur na /
analyzed: nad dang bcas pa dang / chu ser dang / rnag 'dzag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di na skyes bu kha cig gtum zhing ngor smra ba'i rang bzhin can du gyur na /
translated: It becomes sick, and pus and blood flow. In the same way, when some people here are fierce and speak harshly,

original: de chung ngu dang mi dga' ba chung dus kyang khro ba dang gnod sems skyed cing yi mug cing gnas te /
analyzed: de chung ngu dang mi dga' ba chung dus kyang khro ba dang gnod sems skyed cing yi mug cing gnas te /
translated: When they are small and not happy, they generate anger and malice and remain depressed.

original: khro bar yang dag par byed de /
analyzed: khro bar yang dag par byed de /
translated: They are truly angry.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag skyes bu de'i sems ni mdze can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag skyes bu de'i sems ni mdze can lta bu'o //
translated: Monks, the mind of that person is like one with leprosy.

original: dge slong dag sdom pa ma yin pa dang sdom pa dag bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag sdom pa ma yin pa dang sdom pa dag bshad par bya ste /
translated: Monks, I will explain non-restraint and restraint.

original: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen to that well and keep it in mind, I will explain it.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-restraint?

original: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin la phyis chos rnams la lan mang du rjes su rtog pa dang / rjes su dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag mig gis gzugs dag mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin la phyis chos rnams la lan mang du rjes su rtog pa dang / rjes su dpyod par byed do //
translated: Monks, when immature, ordinary beings who are not learned see forms with the eye, they grasp at signs and grasp at particulars, and later they think about and investigate those phenomena.

original: nyes dmigs ma mthong zhing nyes dmigs ma mthong bas lus kyis thag sring bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ma mthong zhing nyes dmigs ma mthong bas lus kyis thag sring bar mi byed do //
translated: Not seeing the faults, not seeing the faults, they do not distance the body.

original: dge slong dag byis pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnam par shes nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin la phyis chos rnams la lan mang du rjes su rtog pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnam par shes nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin la phyis chos rnams la lan mang du rjes su rtog pa dang /
translated: “Monks, childish, ordinary beings, who are uneducated and lack learning, having cognized a sound with the ear, a smell with the nose, a taste with the tongue, a tangible object with the body, and a mental object with the mind, grasp at signs and grasp at secondary marks.

original: rjes su dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpyod par byed de /
translated: Later, they repeatedly think about and investigate those phenomena.

original: nyes dmigs ma mthong zhing nyes dmigs ma mthong bas lus kyis thag sring bar mi byed de /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ma mthong zhing nyes dmigs ma mthong bas lus kyis thag sring bar mi byed de /
translated: Not seeing the disadvantages, and not seeing the disadvantages, they do not distance themselves physically.

original: 'di ni sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdom pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘lacking restraint.’

original: sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is restraint?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos @80a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos @80a * //
translated: Monks, noble disciples🔽who are learned and possess learning, having seen a form with the eye, do not grasp at signs and do not grasp at secondary marks.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa mig gis gzugs mthong nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la zhes bya ba nas lus kyis thag bsrings nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa mig gis gzugs mthong nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la zhes bya ba nas lus kyis thag bsrings nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: They distance themselves physically.

original: 'di ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘restraint.’

original: sdom pa ma yin pa dang sdom pa dag bshad par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa dang sdom pa dag bshad par bya'o zhes ngas ji skad du bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: I will explain in detail what I have taught in brief:

original: dge slong dag dper na skyes bu zhig dgon pa'i aa mra'i nags su song ba na srog chags drug rnyed de /
analyzed: dge slong dag dper na skyes bu zhig dgon pa'i aa mra'i nags su song ba na srog chags drug rnyed de /
translated: “Monks, for example, suppose a man went to an Āmra forest in the wilderness and found six animals.

original: khyi rnyed de khyi bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings shing /🔽bya rnyed pa dang bya bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching pas legs bar bcings shing /🔽ce spyang rnyed pa dang ce spyang bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brten par bcings shing /
analyzed: khyi rnyed de khyi bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings shing / bya rnyed pa dang bya bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching pas legs bar bcings shing / ce spyang rnyed pa dang ce spyang bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brten par bcings shing /
translated: He found a dog and caught it. He bound it well with a rope of hair.🔽He found a bird and caught it. He bound it well with a rope of hair.🔽He found a jackal and caught it. He bound it well with a rope of hair.

original: chu srin byis pa gsod rnyed pa dang chu srin byis pa gsod bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings shing /
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod rnyed pa dang chu srin byis pa gsod bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings shing /
translated: He found a crocodile and caught it. He bound it well with a rope of hair.

original: sprul rnyed pa dang sprul bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brten par bcings shing /
analyzed: sprul rnyed pa dang sprul bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brten par bcings shing /
translated: After finding a snake and catching it, they tie it well with a rope of hair.

original: spre'u rnyed pa dang spre'u bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings te /
analyzed: spre'u rnyed pa dang spre'u bzung nas skra'i thag pa'i 'ching bas legs par brtan par bcings te /
translated: After finding a monkey and catching it, they tie it well with a rope of hair.🔽They tie them together with a single rope and let them go.

original: de dag bar du thag pa gcig gis bcings te btang na spyod yul tha dad pa de dag rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag bar du thag pa gcig gis bcings te btang na spyod yul tha dad pa de dag rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod de /
translated: Since they have different ranges, they each desire their own range and place, and they do not desire the range and place of others.

original: khyi ni grong gi mthar 'jug par 'dod cing /
analyzed: khyi ni grong gi mthar 'jug par 'dod cing /
translated: The dog desires to enter the edge of the village.

original: bya ni nam mkha' la 'phur bar 'dod la /
analyzed: bya ni nam mkha' la 'phur bar 'dod la /
translated: The bird desires to fly in the sky.

original: ce spyang ni dur khrod du 'jug par 'dod de /
analyzed: ce spyang ni dur khrod du 'jug par 'dod de /
translated: The jackal desires to enter the charnel ground.

original: chu srin byis pa gsod ni chu'i nang du 'jug par 'dod cing /
analyzed: chu srin byis pa gsod ni chu'i nang du 'jug par 'dod cing /
translated: The sea monster that kills children desires to enter the water.

original: sbrul ni khung du 'jug par 'dod la spre'u ni rigs su 'jug par 'dod de /
analyzed: sbrul ni khung du 'jug par 'dod la spre'u ni rigs su 'jug par 'dod de /
translated: The snake desires to enter its hole, and the monkey desires to enter its species.

original: dge slong dag 'on kyang spyod yul tha dad cing yul tha dad pa'i srog chags drug po rnams rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod mod kyi //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'on kyang spyod yul tha dad cing yul tha dad pa'i srog chags drug po rnams rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod mod kyi //
translated: “Monks, however, the six beings with different domains and different objects each desire their own domain and object and do not desire the domain and object of others.

original: 'on kyang gang spungs che zhing stobs che bar 'gyur ba de'i rjes su 'gro zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang spungs che zhing stobs che bar 'gyur ba de'i rjes su 'gro zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, they follow and are subject to the one whose domain and object are greater and more powerful.

original: de bzhin du spyod yul dang yul tha dad pa'i dbang po drug po 'di dag rang rang gi yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi yul mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyod yul dang yul tha dad pa'i dbang po drug po 'di dag rang rang gi yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi yul mi 'dod de /
translated: In the same way, these six faculties with different domains and objects each desire their own object and do not desire the object of others.

original: mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs blta bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rjes su mi mthun par @80b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs blta bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rjes su mi mthun par @80b 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye desires to see a pleasant form and is averse to an unpleasant form.

original: rna ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i sgra mnyan par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i sgra mnyan par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ear desires to hear a pleasant sound and is averse to an unpleasant sound.

original: sna ni yid du 'ong ba'i dri mnam bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sna ni yid du 'ong ba'i dri mnam bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nose wants to smell pleasant smells and is averse to unpleasant smells.

original: lce ni yid du 'ong ba'i ro myong bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro dang rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lce ni yid du 'ong ba'i ro myong bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro dang rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: The tongue wants to taste pleasant tastes and is averse to unpleasant tastes.

original: lus ni yid du 'ong ba'i reg bya reg par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ni yid du 'ong ba'i reg bya reg par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body wants to touch pleasant textures and is averse to unpleasant textures.

original: yid ni yid du 'ong ba'i chos rnam par shes par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos dang rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid ni yid du 'ong ba'i chos rnam par shes par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos dang rjes su mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind wants to be conscious of pleasant mental objects and is averse to unpleasant mental objects.

original: dge slong dag spyod yul tha dad pa dang / yul tha dad pa'i dbang po drug po 'di dag ni rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag spyod yul tha dad pa dang / yul tha dad pa'i dbang po drug po 'di dag ni rang rang gi spyod yul dang yul 'dod cing gzhan dang gzhan gyi spyod yul dang yul mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Monks, these six sense faculties, which have different domains and different objects, want their own domains and objects and do not want the domains and objects of others.

original: 'on kyang gang stobs che zhing stobs dang ldan pa de'i rjes su 'gro zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang stobs che zhing stobs dang ldan pa de'i rjes su 'gro zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: But whichever of them is stronger, the others will follow it and be subject to it.

original: de nas skyes bu des srog chags drug po de dag ka ba'am phur pa la legs par bcings te bzhag na pha rol ring du song yang lus ngal ba dang / lus dub pa dang / lus lci bas ka ba 'am phur pa de nyid kyi drung du 'khor zhing 'dug la mngon par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas skyes bu des srog chags drug po de dag ka ba'am phur pa la legs par bcings te bzhag na pha rol ring du song yang lus ngal ba dang / lus dub pa dang / lus lci bas ka ba 'am phur pa de nyid kyi drung du 'khor zhing 'dug la mngon par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the man, having tied those six creatures well to a post or a stake, would leave them there. Even if they went far away, because of their fatigue, exhaustion, and heaviness of body, they would return to the vicinity of that post or stake, and would stay and dwell right there.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni ngas don shes par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni ngas don shes par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa yin te /
translated: “Monks, I gave this example in order to make the meaning clear.

original: 'di ni gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
translated: But you should understand it in the following way.

original: dge slong dag srog chags drug po zhes bya ba 'di ni dbang po drug po rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: dge slong dag srog chags drug po zhes bya ba 'di ni dbang po drug po rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: Monks, ‘six creatures’ is a designation for the six sense faculties.

original: ka ba 'am phur pa legs par bcings te zhes bya ba 'di ni lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: ka ba 'am phur pa legs par bcings te zhes bya ba 'di ni lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: ‘Tied well to a post or a stake’ is a designation for mindfulness directed to the body.

original: dge slong dag lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs blta bar 'dod pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa kun du bsten goms par byas lan mang du byas na mig gis yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs blta bar 'dod pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monks, if you rely on, cultivate, and practice the mindfulness that is directed to the body, then you will not desire to see forms that are attractive to the eye, and you will not be averse to forms that are unattractive.

original: rna bas yid du 'ong ba'i sgra mnyan par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi mthun par 'gyur ro //🔽snas yid du 'ong ba'i dri bsnam par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna bas yid du 'ong ba'i sgra mnyan par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi mthun par 'gyur ro // snas yid du 'ong ba'i dri bsnam par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will desire to hear sounds that are appealing to the ear, and you will not be averse to sounds that are unappealing.🔽You will desire to smell scents that are appealing to the nose, and you will not be averse to scents that are unappealing.

original: lces yid du 'ong ba'i ro myong bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lces yid du 'ong ba'i ro myong bar 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will desire to taste flavors that are appealing to the tongue, and you will not be averse to flavors that are unappealing.

original: lus kyis yid du 'ong ba'i reg bya reg par 'dod cing yid du mi @81a * //🔽'ong ba'i reg bya rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis yid du 'ong ba'i reg bya reg par 'dod cing yid du mi @81a * //🔽'ong ba'i reg bya rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will desire to touch tangible objects that are appealing to the body, and you will not be averse to tangible objects that are unappealing.

original: yid kyis yid du 'ong ba'i chos rnam par shes par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyis yid du 'ong ba'i chos rnam par shes par 'dod cing yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rjes su mi mthun par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mind desires to cognize pleasant phenomena and does not oppose unpleasant phenomena.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: Bhikṣhus, therefore, you should train thinking,

original: gang lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa kun du sten pa dang / goms par byed pa dang lan mang du byed pa de ltar dge slong dag bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa kun du sten pa dang / goms par byed pa dang lan mang du byed pa de ltar dge slong dag bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “We will practice mindfulness related to the body, and we will cultivate and frequently practice it.”
